vQtklS49cwYdTmE308EplA.text: Outstanding service. Waiter knew his products, both foods & wines.  Naturally went with a steak, bone-in rib eye. Darn good but I wouldn't go "exceptional" as Envy advertises. Cooked dead on the requested medium rare temp. Great texture but flavor was slightly less than expected.  Potatoes au gratin were good. Just that, good.  Garlic sauteed spinach was very good but I'd like more of the garlic hit.  Very good. Great service. But based on advertisement set expectations and prices, not exceptional in any category save the server.

jVKJDQvtWs-3qQDO0ojfBw.text: We had this shrimp cocktail for an appetizer, iceberg wedge salad, the Seabass and New York strip steak. Along with the cream corn charred asparagus and mac & cheese. And a bottle of Kings Ridge wine. And then dessert. Everything was superb as was the service from our waiter David. This was one of the best dining experiences that I have had

photos.caption: Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

r8AQvZgi_jqJSfiBHZMi-w.text: I'm not quite sure how this place stays in business. There were very few diners the night we ate here! Service was very nice and attentive. I'm sure the off strip location has not helped them attracting diners. The salads were average but had way too much dressing. We ordered steaks and they were quite tasty. They were perfectly cooked. The sides were decent helpings and had average quality.  Overall, the food quality was not quite matching their menu pricing, but a nice quiet place to dine.

tmdFErWWy8-xSmpxuhxxKg.text: I only tried their brunch menu, since we booked our rooms with the breakfast option at the Renaissance Hotel. It was a sweet deal. We received credit for every night we stayed to have breakfast here with the option of a la carte or buffet style. Breakfast runs until 1100.  The first time I got their Atlantic Smoked Salmon ($18). It was nicely presented, but I think the price is steep for a simple lox bagel if I didn't have hotel credit. I also got their Seasonal Fruit Plate ($15). It was a standard bowl that came with strawberries, pineapple, honeydew, and cantaloupe.   I would recommend the breakfast buffet option if anything. You get a good selection of foods for one price. There was really great steel cut oatmeal and an egg scramble station where you can add in what you want, including salsa, cilantro, onions, and etc. French toast was also available. Food was decent. Orange juice is included with the buffet, but it tasted like carton to me so I wasn't a fan.   Service was average. My first time here already left me sorely disappointed. First impressions are everything! I would recommend this place for breakfast ONLY if you have hotel credit, or you take the buffet route. Otherwise, I say pass. Seems like they are known for their dinner menu more.

photos.caption: Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab Oscar Benedict
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seasonal Fruit Plate
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Atlantic Smoked Salmon

7uJCW1ncaF2Kkc7dgRIskw.text: We went for my boyfriend birthday. Our expectations were exceeded. The food and service was excellent. David and his peers were great. We wish this place was home. Prices can't beat! We enjoyed the wine, steak, lamb, and appetizers.

7NhKbMaqHGdwpDRNwyt36Q.text: It is really 3.5 stars. Rounded up due to the excellent and accommodating service.   I have to make an honest disclaimer - steakhouses annoy me. What you get typically doesn't worth what you have to pay for it.  Now, that it is out of the way, let's get to the review itself.  ENVY is located at inside of the Renaissance hotel in Las Vegas. We had dinner there, but not by choice - Las Vegas had a rare case of horrendous weather with very strong winds, so going out was a bad option. The restaurant offers very substantial wine list (they are recipients of one of the Wine Spectator awards). I didn't look much through the list, as was the only one drinking wine and only needed a glass. I ended up with a glass of Terra d'Oro Barbera from Amador County in California, which was excellent - but 9 oz pour at $19, which greatly exceeds the retail price of the whole bottle. For the first course, I had the Wedge salad - tiny piece of lettuce, probably one eighth of the head - but it was fresh and tasty.  For my main course, I had seared scallops - a whole of 4 scallops for $29. They were very nicely done, no questions, but again, price performance simply doesn't work for me.  We had multiple sides (roasted potatoes, asparagus, mushrooms, spinach, broccoli rabe) - all very tasty.  Excellent, friendly and attentive service.  Would I recommend this place? There is nothing wrong with it, really, but Las Vegas offers so many great food options at a fraction of a price, so I would only say - eat there if you must.

photos.caption: Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. side dishes
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried potatoes
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wedge salad

b9qDgbpmgt5DEQ6NcoSsUA.text: We found out about this place through Groupon and we loved it! Krisztian was our server and he was exceptional. He let us trade a dessert for an extra side with the Groupon and he asked if we were celebrating anything. My dessert plate came out with happy anniversary written on it and freshly dipped chocolate covered strawberries on it. Krisztian offered to take our picture with our anniversary dessert too!  Our filets were delicious. I would definitely recommend this place if you are looking for a quiet steakhouse off the strip a little bit. The monorail takes you .3 miles away from the steakhouse also!!

photos.caption: Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7idXL5g0cwA2OZnGlKuQ0g.text: We just recently tried their Groupon and it was worth EVERY PENNY! The food was delicious and we were given way more food than expected.

dMnizBi5Tn3CJelF06cEdw.text: I will not go back, ever... Gave two stars because the service was good, the food was terrible and you have to pay $10 to park...

ArgjZV961vGElrEv5DK8Gw.text: Fantastic is all I can say! Every bite of everything we ate was absolutely delicious! I started with the Beet salad. One of the best I've ever had. The Rainbow River Trout was grilled to perfection and the Chardonnay sauce was to die for! The asparagus was unbelievable, too. I don't usually care much for asparagus, but I loved it here. The service was subtle yet excellent. (Major, you know who you are!) I will be recommending Envy to all my friends and family.

FAQiGGJ0aRIR6rw3DpQ_iw.text: Best dinner in Vegas!! We had the calamari, Caesar salad, strip steak, mashed potatoes and baked potato. Everything was delicious!! Ask for Krisztian to be your server- he is wonderful!!!!

k2E5AgZPGzugFZwiKayP5Q.text: Dinner date with my wife. We found this by searching for a Groupon. The Groupon was 99 for a 169 dollar meal. We got 2 appetizers 2 entrees 1 side to share and 2 desserts. The dinner was absolutely amazing. For the appetizers we got a crab cakes and a lobster bisque soup. The crab cakes we not dry but moist and full of flavor. The bisque was great and really smooth. For the entrees my wife had a rib eye steak and I had the porter house. The steaks we cooked to perfection. I had a side of bernaise sauce that was excellent. For the sides we had a creamy garlic mashed potatoes. The potatoes had a garlic taste and really moist not dry. The desserts were cheesecake and puff pastries. I was so full I really didn't get a chance to enjoy the desserts until the next morning. The meal was well worth paying full price. Will be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Bisque
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of the best Porterhouse steaks ever.

VEvcEZbpXDrdwNl689G7HA.text: Great fillet done to perfection. The crab tasted very fresh and the mango salsa was a awesome addition. The service was very good. The waiter knew exactly when to appear and didn't interrupt our savoring the meal. The wine list had a bit of everything. Enjoyed our meal in a relaxed semi casual atmosphere.

Z1Dh2oRiE-7V9ao0cPJFVg.text: Ate here tonight. From start to finish - superb! The appetizers were amazing. Get the shrimp cocktail. Ordered the ribeye steak medium rare - perfect! The cream of corn side was excellent. Finally, ask for David the waiter. Impeccable service and his recommendations were spot on!

3YxTVuBho8iM8zoAY8xYGQ.text: Exceptionally ordinary. We had a large group and NONE of us  thought our steaks were good after waiting for an hour to recieve them.

h5t3vEJNHXEni98GbL6MDQ.text: My experience with Envy Steakhouse was exceptional.  Arrived with a big party for dinner and was seated after a short wait.  The decor is modern and unassuming but yet intimate and inviting.  Our servers were attentive, friendly, knowledgeable & had enough tact to give us our privacy.  My Filet Mignon was beautifully cut, aged, & tasted heavenly in my mouth.  The sides were excellent as well as the truffle fries received universal praise from our table.  Overall, I can say that it was a very pleasurable experience to dine at this steakhouse.  Envy indeed ...

photos.caption: Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xcD3lRgVW820PcKfU3-FOA.text: I think a big part of this 5 stars review came from the level of services which we received during your visit. The restaurant is located within Las Vegas Renaissance Hotel, which is a non-gaming business hotel. Due to its location, it is usually quite on weekends and non-convention time. It also effect the restaurant, too. Since majority of the traffic to this restaurant came from the hotel guests. We were immediately seated, there were multiple servers helped us with breads, water and menu ordering, talking about being treated like loyalty here! Decor is contemporary elegant. A nice place to take your date or special someone here, or even good for business lunch too. Since we visited during the lunch hours, so the menu selections are more limited. However here are the break down: Bread - Complimentary with meal. Regular Cabatta bread, Olive bread and cranberries walnut were all warm and fluffy. Entree - We ordered French Dip sandwich which was moist and juicy (Serve with Au Jus and Horseradish), Chicken Pesto Sandwich served on freshly baked bread, and the Envy signature burger with choices of TWO cheeses, TWO toppings (mushroom, bacon..and more) on top of the traditional hamburger condiments (Lettuce, Tomato, Pickles). It was a 1/2 lb burger so quite filling! The patty was cooked to our liking as well. All lunch Burgers/Sandwiches come with choice of fries or salad. I strongly suggest to upgrade to truffle fries ($3). Its worth every-penny. Make sure to get coupons from restaurant.com so we ended up paying our meal for almost 50% off! What a deal! I would recommend this place to others when visiting Vegas.

sVzZkaMOPpKIvd3HK6FvBw.text: Amazing food, and off the strip so you don't have to deal with all that craziness.  The restaurant is gorgeous and the service is great. The steaks are delish, but the standouts have to be all the appetizers and the sides. The corn is to-DIE-for, and the ceviche apps were great. Oh and you HAVE to try the stuffed tomatoes!  Losing a star only because you have to donate a kidney to afford the place. To save some money I recommend getting an app, side and entree for two people. It's more than enough food, trust me!

EZP48XALJf2kGE1Bj_xxkQ.text: Another great meal at Envy.  I think they were sort staffed this time, but the food and drinks were still top notch!

photos.caption: Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. NY Steak.
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seabass with mushrooms and asparagus.
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best Truffle Fries on Earth.

dnynmFYORd9DST_hmBYJUw.text: Just the openers,  amazing. French onion soup and peppered calamari and rock shrimp were delicious. We're waiting on our steaks, lobster mac, & garlic mashed potatoes,  to be followed by some scrumptious dessert.  My sister in law loves this place and I think she's got great taste.  My medium in bone filet was great until i got more middle region.   Too under done for my taste,  but i was really full by then. My husband ate it up like a hungry shark.  He loved it all.

ZVGCpQaYrADl84M5fyaR9g.text: The hostess was very friendly and our server was great. My issue was we never got our soup that we ordered or refills on ice tea. Also the steaks were not cooked right and had to be sent back. They grab your plate from the table then ask you if you done with your food. Ask before you touch my plate. She took my food because I wasn't eating I was in the middle of a conversation and stacked it on another dirty plate then asked me. Not the best place for a wedding dinner. They want you in and out asap!

hxEYTRlW0z3jJp42fBFtdA.text: ENVY The Steakhouse has always been a restaurant we passed by, heard about, but never really thought about dining at. Sure, we heard amazing things about this place, but it's another steakhouse in Vegas. We finally took advantage of their restaurant.com coupon and had a cozy dinner for two. First up - I made reservations on OpenTable.com and requested we sit side by side. Although I do note this in the reservation, it's rarely and sometimes noticed and acknowledged. In this case, the booth had two settings specifically set up side by side. Nice! After a slight delay, we got our beverages and menus. It wasn't too hard to decide. We barely made a dent in our warm bread and butter when our entrees arrived. * Bone-In Ribeye, 17 oz with Wild Mushroom Sauce ($45) * Bone-In Ribeye, 17 oz with Brandied-Pink Peppercorn Sauce ($45) Both orders came with garlic mashed potatoes and roasted seasonal vegetables. One thing I appreciated from our waiter (Joshua) was that he told us that we probably had enough food without ordering sides. And this is usually the part where they push the sides on you, but not in this case. And he was so right! The 17 oz is a big piece of beef, and there's really not a whole lot of room left for much else. The steaks were perfectly cooked rare, and tender and tasty! So tasty that we didn't even bother with our respective signature sauces that came with it. Rather, we didn't even care for the sauces at all. The meat was flavorful all on its own and that's what you call a good piece of beef! Of course, half the fun is experimenting with their three salts and seeing which one goes best with your dish. The garlic mashed potatoes were also good, and the roasted seasonal vegetables also had a good mix of veggies which surprised us. Different kinds of squash, beets, and mushrooms were part of it. Overall, we were pleasantly surprised with the quality of service and food. Service was top notch and the food had us interested in the rests of their menu. Of course, coupons definitely help in this department. 4.5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone-In Ribeye, 17 oz with Brandied-Pink  Peppercorn Sauce ($45)
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone-In Ribeye, 17 oz with Wild Mushroom Sauce ($45)

HPiSlk8YAXZW_lmAXl5QKg.text: I must say I usually never venture to any establishment east side of Las Vegas Blvd but I'm glad I'm adventurous this night because the 17 oz steak is BOMB! People are right, who cares about the sauce, the thick steak with a pinch of salt will do you fine. You will stuff yourself silly with the truffle parmesan fries here also.   The red decor here screams W Hotel meet Texas de Brazil. I am especially surprise that this is not a gaming hotel; where do they make their money???   Some minor misses: The steak is sizzling hot but the plate is not. This usually leads to me not finishing my steak because it gets rather cold quickly. The medium here is more of a medium well so ask for medium rare if you want to see some juices in your Rib eye. I like my steakhouse poppin' but the customers here are sparse for a Friday Night.   overall 4.25 stars / 5

photos.caption: Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye 17 oz

vCXg1h7idzzZsZBP8dNnHA.text: Dear Envy,  You  were a big disappointment. I'm curious as to how you maintain 4 stars.  My friends and I dined here this past weekend to celebrate their birthdays. We had a reservation for 7 people at 5PM on Saturday.   We ordered: Lamb chop-M NY steak-MR 3 Rib eye steak-MR Filet mignon-MR Ahi tuna special Spinach, truffle fries, and mushrooms  It took over 45 minutes to get our food and we were the only ones in the restaurant. When our steaks were served it was either undercooked or overcooked. We were short on time so didn't want to make it a big deal but did let our server know. Only an apology but didn't offer to take it back?! Come on, each steak was $50+.  My ahi tuna special was nothing special at all! It was bland and didn't even taste fresh!  Spinach and mushrooms were fine. You really can't mess up on that, can you? The truffle fries was the best thing we had! SAD!   We appreciate the slices of lemon cake and cheesecake you sent to the birthday folks but that doesn't justify the poorly served foods.  Your server was quite knowledgeable with the menu but can use a few customer service tips.   Thanks, but won't be back!

oJxSPWSVGKSfWQA6IYCdCw.text: The atmosphere was top notch! So pretty and relaxing. Real candles burning.  Wait staff was excellent, from the greeter to the server. Food was delish. Creamed corn and onion soup were my favorite sides. The baked potato was indeed jumbo! Steaks were very tasty. They packed up our to-go food for us, delivered it back in a bag. It was a very relaxing, enjoyable evening! I would recommend Envy :)

YogZHi2FZVzgXpaGt-DMdg.text: I purchased the Living Social Gem of the day yesterday for this restaurant. Upon entering the hotel, I was impressed with how we were greeted, two kind gentleman made us feel welcome. One walked us to the restaurant. The lobby was sleek and modern. Rich red colors. The pool area looked inviting.  We were warmly greeted by the restaurant manger and seated right away.  We both loved the feel of the restaurant. Leather chairs and booths. Reminiscent of  days gone by, but in no way run down. Just a time when life was simpler.  We had two servers , Deonante and Christian, wonderful service by both. Christian was our main server, and did not in any way treated us differently due to our living  social deal. We were told about the menu, the specials and that each meal comes with the garlic mashed and the Brussels sprouts. We shared a caesar salad which was crisp and fresh and the dressing divine. We both chose the bone in filet. We also ordered the creamed bourbon corn.  The meat was perfectly cooked, tender, flavorful, and by far one of the best cuts of meat we have ever had. The corn was delicious and the cream pronounced with a slight taste of the bourbon. The potatoes delicious.     This was one of the finest meals we have ever had. I would select this restaurant over some of the other steakhouses I have been too.  We cannot wait to go back.

b1wccUkFoKYyYn33rcaD_w.text: The server always remembers as. We always dine here whenever we go to LV. We avail of the Restaurant.com coupon but alas, we were told that soon they will no longer honor it. It was nice of the server to let us know so that we dont have to purchase them anymore. BF & I always love their seafood tower. For around $50 its a good price, cheaper than here in SD and substantial. Excellent service as always. Sides of corn is soooo yummy. Will go for more.

photos.caption: Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Other half of Ribeye
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Signature Side Dish - Creamed Corn
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half of Ribeye

VPs2ruqIS7E_09eWV3lZtw.text: I would give a higher rating but it was so expensive it should have been amazing. I've been to Vegas and the one thing you can get is an awesome meal. Not here. I had Parmesan truffle fries as an appetizer. They were great but there was enough to feed 5 people. The lamb chop with tri-colored cauliflower was decent. The bourbon creamed corn sounds better than it is. That my portion of the bill, without alcohol, was $70 is ludicrous!  For that I could've eaten at Emeril's delmonico in the Venetian.

XmQBvDm44Y3wOk4Ta4QYvA.text: YUM! We ate here twice during our stay @ Marriott Renaissance.  We ordered enjoyed sliders, Trio and ahi salad!  All good choices.  Friendly, fast service.  Love their new decor.  Super cool furniture.  I also like all of the windows which makes for a nice open feel.  Bar is nice with T.V.'s for sports and news seekers.  Casual spot.  Nice for lunch or before dinner drinks and appetizers.

F1zErJLoWdMldcalAXq0dQ.text: Some friends and I had dinner at Envy a few weeks ago during a Vegas weekend trip.  The restaurant is located off the strip in the Renaissance Hotel which looks like your run of the mill business hotel.  I was actually surprised to find a steakhouse located inside. The interior of the restaurant has a nice, rich decor and pleasant ambiance.    The service was attentive and friendly. Our waiter was quite knowledgeable and helpful in recommending two bottles of white and red wines for our table.    Our party of 8 ordered the following items:  Bourbon Creamed Corn Hands down the BEST creamed corn I've ever had.  It was mouth wateringly rich but not overly creamy and flavored with so much goodness.  The waiter had noted that this was the most popular dish on the menu and I completely understand why.  We originally had two orders of this dish but it was devoured pretty quickly so we ordered another.  Truffle Fries Tasty stick fries with truffle.  A very substantial serving - one order would have been plenty for our table but I'm quite sure we ordered two.   Bacon Gruyere Mashed Potato Pretty good but nothing out of the ordinary.   Entrees:  Ginger LIme Sea Bass I opted for the sea bass since it came recommended by one of our friends.  It was a very light dish in flavor and moist throughout.  The portion was quite generous as well.  Bone-in Ribeye My boyfriend ordered the bone-in ribeye which we thought was only decent at best.  It wasn't bad, but it wasn't great.  Overall, ENVY steakhouse is worth a visit if you're looking for a nice meal off the strip.  The bourbon creamed corn absolutely blew us all away and remains the most memorable part of our dinner.  I'd go back just for that dish!

photos.caption: Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Fries
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bourbon Creamed Corn

izPIp6pg9xW_4hK2FeZu_Q.text: TRUFFLE FRIES!!!  Yes I have been on a binge for truffle fries, I blame the Four Seasons in Las Vegas for introducing me to them, now if I see them on a menu, I have to order them!  The truffle fries here were GOOD! and worth the $9.   Spice-Seared Ahi Tuna with the Sesame-Seaweed Salad, Pacific Rim Sauce - $16 - pricy for what you get but never the less tasty!  I had the Warm Spinach salad with Goat Cheese Croquette, Pancetta, Warm Bacon-Balsamic Vinaigrette - 4.5 stars!  Ambience is nice and service is pretty good too.

EWJ56CKW2FF7svipTjYrLA.text: On a recent vacation trip to Las Vegas, my wife and I decided to try Envy--I'm a sucker for a good steakhouse.   Service and ambience were excellent. It's dark and quiet and the staff were exceedingly polite and helpful.   I had a bone-in filet mignon which was quite good; I've never had a filet served bone-in. Very tender, very tasty, done to perfection.   It's a bit off the beaten track (the Renaissance is right near the convention center, and if you take the monorail, there's a short walk across a parking lot to get there) and tends toward the pricey, but made a nice change of pace from the Strip.

dvAS7ko29fY0csH8MgjDHA.text: I came here on a Monday night for my parents' 40 year anniversary dinner. I recommended this place after all the excellent yelp reviews. Boy was I disappointed with the food. The service provided by our waitress was great. We ordered the tomahawk steak and ribeye, medium and medium rare, respectively. Both steaks came out medium well. The worse part was that the tomahawk was not to be presliced since we wanted to take photos. The waitress told the kitchen not to slice it. But when the steak arrived it was pre-sliced. This ended up being a very disappointing and frustrating dinner.

hWjrbd-kXpI8setqAuvGdA.text: This food was incredible and the service impeccable.  This was the best ribeye that I have ever tasted.  Josh was our waiter and he catered to our every need. The bar made our favorite Hendricks cucumber martini off menu. This was the single best experience I've had in Vegas.

5GNlIaN7B1BM4YRJCk5ExA.text: Oh my gosh. I literally cannot say enough good things about this place. I've been several times, have never had anything bad on the menu and have never had bad service. I've been by myself several times as well and they always treat me as if I am the only person in the restaurant. You will be doing yourself a great disservice if you don't go and try it..

iIGgRO0Doi_SKkBhaGvLaw.text: I'm so pleased with ENVY! I was gifted a $50 restaurant.com coupon and from the different options, this sounded the best to me. My GPS decided to route me to a sketchy part of town, but eventually the directional mishap was fixed. When we got here, our server (Jacob, Justin, Joseph?) was very polite, friendly, and professional. He didn't give us any attitude for using a coupon or not ordering wine. I really appreciated that. Our server suggested the $95 tomahawk steak, which would be perfect for sharing for two. We also ordered a side of mac and cheese. While we were waiting, we had a nice warm bread basket and butter brought to us. An amuse bouche of gazpacho was brought out for us to try before our steak was served. We asked for the steak to be cooked bloody rare, and they did the cut justice. The attempt to finish the food was quite a feat. There were leftovers despite our best efforts. The steak was brought out with a trio of salts, which were nice to try. Our server was very knowledgeable, friendly, and attentive. I'm very pleased with Envy and I would recommend it as a dining option to someone looking for a fancy feast in Vegas.

y8b2Rf5F9t2P98AKS7xXbA.text: This place was quite a nice surprise. It was inside the hotel we were staying at and it is off the strip. We had lunch and breakfast here and the steak is a must have!  very tender and full of flavor and cooked perfectly! as for value and quality it rivals other strip steak houses that cost double. i would go back to envy for sure even if i wasn't staying at the hotel. (fyi: the hotel is the Renaissance hotel)

pxcYfEsEJ6ziTi18OFjUtw.text: In a town of many, many quality steak joints, this place is still worth mentioning. It's no Carnevino or Cut, but the prices won't give you a heart attack, either. Their wine list was well priced and they had a nice lineup of seafood options for those that aren't into red meat. I made the "mistake" of getting the crab stuffed filet. Although it was decent, I can't say it really was a good chance to try to real quality of the meat. I'll assume the other steaks are better based on reactions from the diners at my table that didn't select the crab stuffed filet ! The special salts and sauces served with the steaks are pretty awesome. They include 3 different primo salts and a choice from a nice list of sauces (bernaise, peppercorn, etc). I like that these things are included. They also include a portion of veggies - a nice value add as well. Service was well... weird. We asked for a particular '05 wine and were brought the '06 and he was a little rude when we said we didnt' want the '06. It was a little annoying that he tried to pretend it was the year we asked for when it wasn't! Also, one of our diners was brought the completely wrong steak (ribeye instead of filet!). He ate it anyway, but they apologized quite a bit and gave us a discount. I'll come back for the real stuff next time (mb a filet or ribeye!), but my overall impression was good. For a top tier steakhouse at not-so-bad prices (especially with a restaurant.com coupon!), this place should be on your short list.

9vb2YWWi0PgY_Vw-PdciyQ.text: Best experience I have been too made Valentine's Day extra special. I loved it! Also our server Stephanie was amazing so going back

Sa6vjc3BCQiMNQ_1VV0A4Q.text: The food was great but the service was a whole other story...  Had to wait over 30mins for my filet even though the restaurant was empty. Got my filet but it still took another 15mins for my glass of wine that I had ordered right after ordering my dinner. I could tell this was not the waiters fault since he did a good job at trying to make jokes about things taking so long. I then waited another 20 mins for my bill.

TZVTbM7EqXtZg7c7XVgzCw.text: Absolutely the rudest people in the world! Purchased a restaurant.com in 2013 for 112.50 which DOES NOT EXPIRE and clearly states on the certificate that it does not expire. Went to make reservations, and I told the person that I would be using the certificate, he placed me on hold 3 different times only to tell me that the general manager said he would not be accepting the certificate. That's too bad, we were going to have a rehearsal dinner there, but not anymore!

vkoTa-814fTgpmta1EURtw.text: I was first impressed with the birthday card the restaurant had the hostess give me when we came in. Our Open Table reservation mentioned our celebration, and they shined at making me feel special with that thoughtful gesture. Our waiter was very informed and enthusiastic about the wine selection. We shared a bottle of a special house wine that was very tasty and went well with our meal. My Love and I shared the spinach salad with goat cheese, pancetta, warm bacon-balsamic vinaigrette with bacon on top. It was really good, and a very interesting flavor. Our friends shared the Caesar salad with romaine leaves, white anchovy, and black pepper croutons, and both agreed it was the best Caesar salad they've ever had. The four of us did the best style of eating, what I call tag-team eating, where we order two different items and share, so we can try more dishes. Our party ordered two of each of the: -17 oz. Bone-In Rib Eye -Chilean Sea Bass The rib-eye was absolutely delicious. It wasn't just large. It was large, tender, well-seasoned, and well-grilled. The sea bass just melted like butter in your mouth. It was so good! The sides were good, too. The roasted seasonal vegetables were fresh and seasoned with rosemary. The garlic mashed potatoes were smooth and satisfying. My friends shared a dessert, the bittersweet chocolate lava cake with pistachio ice cream and mint sauce (yelp.com/biz_photos/Fy4t...). They loved it. Service was sporadic, but it seemed intended so that we could enjoy our experience, not just dine and dash. Overall, we had a great dinner experience, and I'd love to come back another time. The discounted GC from restaurant.com really helped with making this special meal more affordable, and because I love savings, I enjoyed this experience more because of it.

photos.caption: Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bittersweet chocolate lava cake with pistachio ice cream and mint sauce
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed grilled vegetables
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic mashed potatoes

MJIXbqCXDwscmJB-yXwIvA.text: I visited envy around 7pm with a few friends. we were seated immediately near the brigade/expedite like. I could see a chef standing behind the line with his hands in his pockets talking to a waiter. as we sat, the waitress assigned to our table pushed in our chairs, placed napkins on our laps, and poored water while taking our drink orders. shortly after, another person brought bread, which he was unfamiliar with. he literally said "I think this is garlic or something."   I ordered a 14oz veal porterhouse medium rare and received a pork chop. the waiter then argued that it was veal. it was white meat which was burnt and dry.  I will not return

yF5PkMeJblxA5oTuT5D8rg.text: After a 3 minute walk from the Las Vegas Convention Center monorail station, we found Envy to be quite busy on a Saturday night. Many were dressed rather informally (not us), which was kind of surprising. My boyfriend thought it was because we saw a "Welcome -insert engineering firm here-" sign. The atmosphere was very calm and friendly. Service was great, I really like how our waitress attentively watched all of her tables in case they needed anything. We had the signature 19 oz bone in ribeye done "medium-plus" between medium and medium well - because my boyfriend likes it rarer than I do. It was definitely right on the money, but you could really taste the effect of the dry aging on the more rare parts, it was fantastic. We also had the beef cheeks that had been slow cooked for several hours. The beef cheeks were ridiculously tender, had a pretty thick balsamic vinegar sauce, and tasted better when in the same bite as the truffle mashed potatoes they were served with. This was a good dish to try, but I'd go back for the ribeye. We didn't order any side dishes and were still pleasantly full from 2 entrees. Oh yeah, don't forget the restaurant.com g/c - we used a $25 one on a Saturday night with no problems.

qPapklsyabSpYVilQmfw4g.text: We just got back from a weekend of shows and slots in Vegas and this was one of the winners for the weekend. Similar to Phil C. we had three in our party and a $200 gift certificate from restaurant.com. This place is a steal with the coupon....but besides that, it's absolutely worth the cab for it's location behind the strip. Yelper tips on the truffle fries are spot on. The portion is huge and even if you don't factor in the truffle oil, the fries are seasoned perfectly and topped with parmesan cheese. We had trouble finishing our main course due to trying to restrain ourselves from eating all the fries and the delicious warm bread selection. We had a NY strip, filet mignon and sea bass. All three were exceptional. The service was great and the wine list is reasonable. Although I would have liked a sauvignon blanc choice from New Zealand. The sides are also tasty. This is better than Ruth Chris. You won't be disappointed.

11Pi0u9j4xav-CrzoqtSjg.text: Really enjoyed the food at ENVY. The ambience was fine given the location...I didn't expect much from the Renaissance hotel. Our hostess and server were a little annoying because my party had to wait quite awhile even though the place had plenty of room and the waiter kept pressuring us to eat/drink more since we had a minimum order required to use our Restaurant.com certificate: Crab cakes Seared Ahi tuna BLT wedge Truffle fries 3 cheese mac and cheese Grilled asparagus with hollondaise Petite filet mignon with foie gras butter Bone-in ribeye AND a few glasses of vino to boot upon the waiter's insistence. Everything was stupendous aside from the crab cakes, not that they were bad. The crab cakes were just not as mind-blowingly good as the rest of the dinner.

anKBGfBknD5m1LP0298fKw.text: Really? I had to make reservations for this place? Because on a Saturday night over Labor Day, this Envy The Steakhouse was completely dead. There was one other table in there. When we left, there were maybe 5. We had a restaurant.com coupon, so thank goodness we didn't pay full price for this place, because I would've rather taken my money to Fleming's. Our waiter was this super mellow guy, and was really nice. He did pay attention to details because he knew we didn't want ice in our water and made sure he didn't accidentally pour it in when it came to refills. It's the little things. Well, the big thing was the price. We ordered the 10 oz. filet mignon to share between us for $45 and paid a $5 split plate charge. $45?? Are you kidding me?? We started with the gnocchi which had wild mushrooms and parmesan fondue, which was pretty good. We also ordered the steamed broccolini. The steak was definitely not worth the money, because the outside was cooked to a slight crisp (not a problem for me because I like a bit of char), but the inside ranged from well-cooked on the sides, to cold red center, which is not good. A well-cooked filet, ordered medium rare, is a cool pink throughout. What I also didn't like was that they cut the steak in half for us and brought it out on two plates, just because we split it. Well, it probably didn't get to cook enough since you cut the sucker open, and it got colder by the time you brought it to the table. What was good was that your entree comes with a small crock of mashed potatoes and roasted season vegetables, which was yummy. That's a nice addition, considering most steak places just give you a steak, a la carte. They had forgotten the steamed broccolini and didn't bring it out until we asked for it. We had a wine from their seven for seven list, which was pretty good for $7. The ambience was very hotel/steakhouse-like. I still felt like I was in a hotel, and I thought the decor was trying a bit hard to be on a more upscale than what it really was. At least I didn't have to dress up to eat here. They didn't balk at my track suit jacket I had with me because I was too lazy to pack anything dressy for the trip. So glad we didn't pay full price for it. It was barely worth it even with the coupon. I do not have steak ENVY.

Kv-buvAbYp3w_P-b8eY1rw.text: This is a very long overdue review.  We've been there 3 times since the summer of 2014.  Having a Living Social deal led us to try this restaurant.  It was our anniversary and the staff made us feel so special, from beginning to end.  My partner is picky and he was very happy and satisfied with his meal and overall experience.  We returned two more times and continued to have the same satisfaction. All members of the staff have always been very nice and attentive.  We had the young lady serve us twice (forgive me, I forgot her name... I feel horrible) and she was always so pleasant and awesome. She even greeted us when she wasn't our server.   We enjoy this place when we don't want to deal with the hustle and bustle of the strip but want a nice night out.

K-z0X7G7mAMMDM2f0RoPhA.text: There corn and Mac and cheese is to die for. Cheap at $8 a dish compared to other steak houses that charge $12.

VF2R3R3QmWCQDyaTyZ7vMA.text: Stephanie Valdovinos showed me and my brother some mad love. Great service, she took care of us. Gave us some great dinner suggestions as my bro and I could not decide on a dish. I went with the New York Steak and my bro had the Ribeye. The Lobster mac n cheese was on point. I'm especially impressed with Stephanie's suggestions for things to do while in Vegas. I would share but I'd like took keep these hidden gems between her me and my brother. I will be back in 3 weeks and will be definitely coming back to Envy The Steakhouse and asking for Stephanie.

UHLYc4ubPwrFg2EZc1yLdQ.text: Service was wonderful and the hotel itself was gorgeous!  My salmon was perfect and my husband's filet mignon looked amazing... I truly was disappointed I couldn't sample his steak--medium rare streak and pregnant ladies don't mix. :(

IhU10RLunYuryv49S-0Q6g.text: Went here for lunch today to meet a colleague.  I ordered the Burger with Cheddar Cheese & Jalapenos with a side of Fries.  The food came out fast and as ordered.  The Burger was good....not great.  The Fries were outstanding.  The service was good and my meeting went well.  Overall it was a good experience, but for $14 I've had better Burgers.  Will I return?  I usually have business lunches here because of it's proximity to the Strip & Convention Center.....so I will probably return.  I wouldn't take the family here for dinner....just not good enough for the price in my opinion.

photos.caption: Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Kh5EKZ-EHCDiiFIqahY-KA.text: This is a very average steakhouse for the money.  I say this with having been to many excellent steakhouses around the country, but locally steakhouses that charge the same amount but are far better include: The Striphouse, Andiamo and Morton's to name a few.  I'm not trying to be hurtful in my review, but if you're going to charge these prices I expect a couple things great, flavorful food and outstanding customer service.  Neither of these were displayed.  If this had been one of my very first steakhouses I had ever been to I probably would have thought it to be ok, but when when you're in the vacation destination of the world...step it up or charge a reasonable amount for what you get.  You have competition and they are currently killing you.   My husband and I ordered the Tomahawk steak for 2 ($95) and we ordered it rare (we're from the midwest and like our beef with the most flavor) along with the asparagus and lobster mac n cheese.   What I didn't like: How little seasoning or flavor there was to the Tomahawk.  The tomahawk was served with asparagus (which is not noted on the menu) this would have been wonderful if the server knew what dishes came with what for the evening and then we would have tried another option. The bernaise sauce was fair, it almost tasted sour.  The service was average for an Applebee's.  We were there on a Wednesday night - it was not busy.  We waited, for everything...them to take our order, for drink refills, the check.  From the time we sat down until our food arrived at our table was 50 minutes - unacceptable. Things I liked: They didn't charge you $5 for sauces for your steak like some other places do.  All of their sides were only $8 I just feel like people should know that for the same amount of money they can have much tastier steaks and extremely better service at other steakhouses in the area for the same price or less.

qhoVDXIxULDLiSrcQJwOVQ.text: Loved this steakhouse. Came here with my girlfriend for our anniversary and we were greeted like VIP's. We ordered the tomahawk rib eye with a side of mushrooms and truffle fries. This place knows how to cook their steak! Ours came out to a perfect medium rare where it was nice and juicy throughout. A complimentary card and dessert were presented to us after our meal. I couldn't recommend this place any more; perfect atmosphere, perfectly cooked meal, & a perfect night!

c7xabOKDHLqHG8eKDkcRpQ.text: I was here to celebrate my girlfriend's birthday and purchased the groupon. Made a reservation at 7pm. When we first got there, hostess(sorry, u were amazing but forgor yout name) welcomed us, and seated us simultaneously. Our server was Major and he explained briefly about the menu. We ordered   Appetizer Cocktail Shrimp : I do not like the shrimp, but my girl told me that it was amazing Crab Cake: Delicious, tasted amazing, was not plain, nor too strong with lot of sauce  Entree Bone-in Ribeye: Mid rare, it was crispy outside, juicy incide, just like I always wanted steak to be Porterhouse: Huge, Juicy inside, wished it was as crispy as ribeye outside, but it was still good  Side Wild Mushroom: very soft, a bit salty, but it was still good  French Fries, i think it was called "frites": amazing, thin crispy french fries with parmesan cheese on the top.  Dessert   Cheesecake : topped with some berries. How can it be wrong?  Chocolate cake : Had a side of scoop of ice cream. It was tasty and great finish for us  Food was amazing like what i mentioned above, but what surprised me from our server Major is that he realized my girl was having hard time which side she wants to get between mushroom and frites. at the end, We chose mushroom. Major wanted to make sure we have a great experience, and he surprised us by letting chef know that we were hesitating between mushroom and frites. He got us both sides to eat so we get the full experience! Which was quite a surprise, and Envy Team went above and beyond. We are glad we decided to visit here instead of one of the steakhouse inside of the strip. We will definitely be back.  Thank you envy team!

UOOCrBf298u7tMi9zzyySw.text: Skip this place - there are better steak houses.   Decided to eat here because I'm staying at the Renaissance Hotel. Made it clear how I wanted my steak cooked. Service was good, waiter professional and attentive.   Steak came out under cooked, Mac and cheese came out hot. Sent the steak back to have it cooked more but when it came back it was still under cooked. Mac and cheese was now cold. Brought mashed potato's as a way of saying sorry - problem was they were cold as well...  So, under cooked steak, cold Mac and cheese and Luke warm potatoes. No visit from the manager and it took forever for the bill to arrive.   I expected more and the manager should have made a table visit. Again I'd skip this place and go somewhere else.  Shared my experience with the front desk and they said they would share it with the food and beverage manager.   No contact, reached back out with the front desk and they confirmed they did share it with him. Still no contact or email.   So even with a complaint or concern the food and beverage manager didn't feel the need to reach out and chat.   Skip this place - not very good and no customer service

SJ2_ti6XeOiF5OyoK3LPtQ.text: It is the worst place to have breakfast. Even Breakfast at 7Eleven is better. Breakfast was cold, coffee as plainly as water with coffee color. It doesn't matter if you order from menu or buffet. Even employees who work there wouldn't drink their own coffee :(  I definitely would never go back here ever !!!

__dNnKaa7ADaqhGBmfn74A.text: Highly recommend this steakhouse if you are visiting Las Vegas. Centrally located across the convention center. We purchased the Groupon and we want to come back. Crab cake appetizer and ribeye was delicious. Waiter was very attentive to us.

MsAun57HAJI47XkQsYTHuw.text: OMG this place is amazing, if you want great service with excellent food you must try this spot out. I'm so surprised they did not have a packed house how amazing their food and service is. If i ever plan a future trip to Vegas I will definitely go back there with no hesitations.

yxCzp3etERWJouif0v1Ucg.text: Thank you Envy Steakhouse for holding up to our expectations! My wife and I had a great birthday dinner, from the shrimp cocktail and shrimp and calamari appetizers, to my wife's amazing filet and my awesome rack of lamb. Kudos to Joshua and David for the amazing recommendations and service. We come to Vegas once or twice a year from Fort Worth, Tx....we will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome dinner for my wife&#39;s birthday!  Appetizers, entree, and desserts were on point! Joshua and David took excellent care!

SI1qEF9cnawMQgBYgAxkgg.text: Excellent food & service!  Enjoyed the restaurant week menu, filet mignon was super tender and delicious!  Best steak I had in a long time.

6_1HtSu8Wl31I17zbc6DGQ.text: Very disappointed in the quality of our New York steaks.  It is obvious that the grade of beef served is not "prime".  The meat was somewhat tough and chewy, not worthy of its $54 price tag.  The side dishes of fries and asparagus were excellent, salads and appetizers equal in quality and taste.  Service was very attentive and gracious.  After 4 visits, we will not be returning.

ZheBGUKb74oijF0aPWX3gQ.text: This place is so elegant, the food is delicious! The i had the Filet Mignon is to die for!!! It literally melted in my mouth! I know right! The sound if it is as good as it was!!! Every item we had was delicious from the appetizers to the main course to the side dishes! The most delicious. This place is great for date night with the honey or a nice girl night out! Or heck you wanna treat your self out this is the place!  Now the customer service was impecable!!!! We felt welcome and taken care of. Our server Major was the absolute best! Very nice and professional. The whole staff was amazing. Thank you Michael Fernando, Joshua, and our awesome server Major. And everyone else part of that awesome team.

photos.caption: Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AG0dh1-iHT_M0spjKuQg0Q.text: As we go through our lives we all do our best to not partake in the cardinal sins, better known as the 7 deadly sins. One these sins is Envy- I'm sorry but this Envy is worth experiencing once in your life... Yes Envy Steakhouse in Las Vegas. Me and my wife really wanted a nice Steak dinner, and trust me Envy was, is, and will be the spot we enjoy for hopefully many years to come. Located within the Renaissance Hotel absolutely gorgeous hotel, the restaurant located inside is beautiful as well. If your looking for great service look no further, we had the best server Joshua, really great guy. Seated right away the menu is great, offering all the steaks you would want, my wife ordered the 18oz. Ribeye, which was cooked perfectly. I had ordered the Filet Mignon and a lobster tail on the side which came stuffed with a crab cake overtop, great dinner. We had enjoyed an ice bottle of Groth that I had brought in, which they do charge a corkage fee but the manager took care of us, wife allergic to wine. But, there is a major star of this show that deserves all to partake in, it's the Mac N' Cheese, This has to be the best Mac n' Cheese I've had not just in along time, but ever. Jakes Mac n' Cheese from Truxtons was one of the best and now gone off the menu, but trust me, please if you go and enjoy a very nice dinner, please please please order the Mac n' Cheese. To top the dinner off we ordered the Cheesecake, fantastic flavor with fresh berries on top. From The Ambiance, to the service, and the food was amazing, we will be remembering this dinner for years to come, I hope we return way before that, trust me, if you all knew what we had experienced you would be Envious, so please next time in Las Vegas, your going to experience Gluttony, Lust, maybe Greed, do yourself a favor and begin your evening with Envy!

A2zzai17rsTKNW-0JMQvZw.text: Great atmosphere, excellent food..amazing people.. Joshua our server was super nice and helpful. I dont think we could of had a better experience. Great for date nights!!

photos.caption: Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YZgWFeWoKPusTPN6YaTxBA.text: Made a reservation but had to wait 30 mins to be seated. There were tables open but the restaurant was under staffed. Waiter was good and on top of things once we were seated. Food was very good.

_-4OocrqRYA2NQNiOC2aWw.text: My husband and I came here on Saturday night with a groupon. It's kind of strange though, the hostess asked us if we were celebrating a special occasion, which we were- an 8 year wedding anniversary. So we thought at the end they'd maybe write happy anniversary on our dessert plates, which they didn't. So we just thought it was strange they ask that and do nothing with it ? Anywho, the waiter was very nice, explained the groupon and how it works, which I already knew, but he was nice about it. I was a little bummed that I ordered a ribeye and the waiter came back apologizing that they're out, so I picked the porterhouse. I really wanted the marbled ribeye though !! Ughh. Anyways, the portions were huge, it was delicious. We both got the same thing with the bortelaise sauce. Very red wine tasting, it went great with the steak. Over all everything was delish! And great service. I only ate half of mine and we ended up donating the other half with the fries to a homeless man. Btw, we were dressed up. Looked fancy in there.

GfM_G9-MuzE_cESdoh5ioQ.text: We were new to dining at Envy Steakhouse.  Dining with a Groupon gift was a delight.  We started our evening with appetizers of Calamari and Shrimp Cocktail.  Both were very good.  The shrimp in the cocktail were jumbo size.  Next our ribeye bone- in steaks were delivered, cooked to our specifications.  Delicious Nebraska Beef.  We shared mashed potatoes that were the real deal and tasted amazing.  Although very stuffed, we finished with a chocolate mousse cake that was sinfully good.  Such wonderful friendly staff, a very private booth seating and great food makes Envy a great place to eat.  I am a fan and recommend checking out this place.

ae5CYjJfZelDT6zoHBj35Q.text: 10 out of 10!! This made us leery on the way here because it was so far off the strip. BUT I have never had a better steak than at Envy. Service was outstanding, our meal was exceptional.

photos.caption: Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wvEthllvPWgGEueiXLEoVw.text: Great steaks and you have to try the creamed corn!  And for dessert have the cheesecake... It's a beautiful restaurant

ybSUjMce4ZpEZU6ZM7LZKQ.text: This place would not be my choice for dinner in Vegas. It is ok, but in a city like Vegas where there are so many amazing restaurants, being ok isn't good enough. I made this reservation about two weeks in advance. When we arrived, I was taken to my table within 2 minutes then proceeded to have to stand there as the (host? manager?) cleared the table and reset it as we had been taken to a dirty table. As we were being seated, we were asked if we had a groupon or travelzoo offer (which we didn't). I was confused about why we were asked when other tables we saw being seated weren't asked. Maybe we "looked" like bargain hunters? Our server David came and asked us if we were ready to order. He didn't go over any specials or recommend anything on the menu. We ordered drinks which he brought quickly (they had a pretty nice wine list) then ordered our entrees and proceeded to 35 minutes for our food to arrive. He stopped by once during that time and said he would check on our food. When it finally arrived our entrees were very good while the sides were incredibly bland. We had the sea bass and herb crusted lamb. The fish was incredibly tender and had a great flavor. The lamb was good but not very different than what I've had in other places. We had a show to go to so we asked for our check which was brought promptly. Overall this visit was largely underwhelming. I enjoyed my visit to the Top of the World the previous evening much more.

photos.caption: Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-GZDfypnhRHdJ_tuhe28Ow.text: Had dinner here as our team didn't want to leave the property and explore. Overall, pretty sub par for the prices they charge. Service was fine, but food was really nothing to write home about although the sea bass was quite good. Lamb was salty and lacked any real flavor and my coworker who order chicken parmigiana (I know, you don't go to steakhouses to order chicken parmigiana but she doesn't eat red meat) came out with the chicken almost completely raw. They took that and her glasses of wine off of the bill as a make good which was a nice gesture. We also had a side of asparagus which was barely cooked and had no seasoning. In general, many other places to eat at for the same prices or cheaper that are significantly better than this place in Vegas.

x58j9gNB0NUTwilES_yjCQ.text: My colleague and I had dinner here because we just flew in.  I ordered the Chilean sea bass with the house salad and my colleague ordered the chicken Parmesan.  My dish was good but my colleagues was just ok.  The dishes were over priced and I expected much better service. I have to take a star away because it we had to wait a while to be seated and it was pretty empty.  I was surprised at the charges, since it was a la carte and will probably go to their grill next door tomorrow.

R2wmEaMEnUBSh1hWp-n24w.text: 2 back ot back days of #PerfectService from Arnulfo! Tasty America Breakfast!  And yummy steak dinner  last night!

HNe8e3Li5Q3ZoKY0Wzd_ow.text: First please know that this place is only a steakhouse for dinner. There is no steak available during lunch time.   We went during CES week, so waiting times were 1hr plus, however, I must say that the host was kind enough to give us a table when we returned 20 minutes later than our assigned seating time.   I tried the roasted tomato soup, which was ok, and then had the Seared Tuna Salad, which was great.  In a town with SO MANY dining options, this is definitely one worth checking out.

qspn90hmMu468Ln80veK_Q.text: So we got a restaurant.com coupon and decided to use it at this place. We calculated that with for the price of an entree per person (there was 4 of us), we'd get 3 sides and 2 desserts extra. It was too good of a deal to pass up. The three sides we ordered were the truffled french fries, mac and cheese and wild mushrooms. The french fries were quite addicting and we couldn't get enough of it. On top of that, it was HUGE, the 4 of us couldn't finish it (with our meals of course). The mac and cheese was done the way I like it. Crispy on the outside, and not too wet on the inside. The mushrooms went well with our meal, but didn't exactly wow us. We ordered the Sea Bass and Rib eye and NY strip. We weren't big fans of the meat. It wasn't as juicy or tender as we thought it'd be. Honestly, Ruth Cris would have tasted better. Maybe they were having an off night. The Sea bass was delicious though. Cooked to perfection, I think all the guys wished they ordered the sea bass instead of the meat after tasting it. It was definitely cooked well. We ordered the Bittersweet Chocolate Lava Cake and Grand Marnier Panna Cotta for dessert. Both were delicious but the lava cake got absolutely destroyed first. The service was great. Our server, Josh, treated us like royalty. The best part was at the end of the meal, we hadn't printed out our restaurant.com coupon. He walked us out to the hotel lobby and got front desk to let us use their printer in order to print out the coupon. Kudos for them!

3QAJn9jNSA7rGKghjK9AcQ.text: Oh Envy (NV), where have I been all your life! This gem is near the Convention Center but didn't seem to have attracted any guests from Cowboy Christmas, better for my group of 7. The food was outstanding, the service attentive, the atmosphere lively but not rushed, and the whole experience memorable. It was even possible to hear conversation; no 90 dB music blasting. The wine room is beautiful to behold, even tho' I no longer drink. (Sigh.) Try truffle fries, blackened salmon, warm Kalamata olive rolls, brandied bread pudding... I'll return soon. Valet parking is free with validation.

x2WqH8oR8LVn9eez4qhNLw.text: This restaurant was not the business.  I chose this place to celebrate my partner's birthday along with 10 of his friends. Horrible service and lacking ambience. We were all disappointed with the service and the food.  Being that the restaurant was empty, our food came out about an hour and half late, cold and bland.   Two of my friends ordered New York strips (well done) and received filet mignon (medium well).  The lobster mac-n-cheese tasted like they poured their lobster bisque soup over elbow noodles.  When the waiter returned with the New York strips, the inside was still medium well, which caused my partner and friend to return the food.  While one waiter bought out the birthday cake another waiter began distributing the dessert plates with no forks which made no sense because we then had to recollect them to place the slices of the cake on the plates...and still they did not bring out forks after we requested them.  We ended up cleaning our dinner forks to eat our cake.  Let just say, I would never ever recommend this restaurant to anyone.  If I had to describe ENVY Steakhouse in one word-GARBAGE!

WV4WvrJ7GS9iejamxCdk4Q.text: Delicious flavorful, moist succulent 40 oz rib eye! Delicious 4 cheese Mac and cheese. We were very impressed! Come hungry or split with up to 4 people. Well worth the money.

Yzn_XmFHrQqTHAdLRQp9lw.text: I had a dinner for 2 award certificate and decided to use it at this restaurant. This was definitely a high-class restaurant and you end up paying for it. All the appetizers cost $16 and the steaks cost $45. We ordered the gnocchi and calamari for the appetizers. The portions were generous and the gnocchi was delicious. We were almost full after the appetizers.   We ordered the rib eye and it was disappointing. Both rib eyes seemed burnt on the outside and I could taste the burntness. It was cooked medium in the inside, but it tasted bland. For a $45 steak, I expected more.   I ordered the creme brele for desert and it was only OK. The caramelized sugar was over flamed and it too had a burnt flavor.   The one good thing was the waiter was extremely nice and professional. However, this restaurant was too expensive and not worth the value. If it wasn't for the award certificate, I would not have eaten here.

eghfPtraKt8TMqSS3tLR4g.text: The service was excellent,  took great care in noting my food allergies, food delicious, and readonably priced.

hX9M81KERcMI3eD_S85f_g.text: Top notch steak house where everything on the menu is excellent, from appetizers to entrees (at least everything our large party had). Service is outstanding, even when the place gets busy.

ltzjShxeJIYBgLeNKgB8mw.text: Wow. Where do I even begin?  I went to Envy with a co-worker and some of his friends. We got there a little late but our table was waiting for us mainly because there was a whopping 4 tables sat in the entire dining room at nearly 8pm.  The service was incredibly slow, to the point where how long it would take between courses or until we even saw our server again were the running jokes throughout the meal. We waited for EVERYTHING which is astonishing considering there was no business in the venue.  The food was typical steakhouse with zero flare and creativity. My ribeye was one of the thinnest cut ribeyes I have ever seen, I will say it was cooked a perfect MR which is nice to see. The side I had ordered, Mac n cheese, wasnt even brought to the table (somehow managed to get Wild Mushrooms instead).  Overall.....the company around me was excellent, the decor was nice, but the restaurant itself was on the bottom end of what Las Vegas has to offer.

yx4aP2zd53pa3yP-po_kyg.text: Absolutely delicious and the staff treats you like family! Definitely a hidden gem off of the strip. Do try to make reservations but they are worth checking out. :)

RLQ9DElI-JTLoKnkiknaYQ.text: Went for parent's anniversary mostly as we had a certificate from Groupon.    Sea bass was fantastic.  I typically don't like sauces but it paired perfectly. Creamed corn was awesome. Pass on the creme brulee.  Located by the convention center and usually don't go to that area often.  Overall was decent but probably won't make it back unless we have another coupon.

8f9hZbJ0OLQ9K9ZKkIg_oQ.text: Awesome Steak(14 oz filet,bone in)  fantastic atmosphere. Wish this was my dinning room.

ToN7hSbGggY6aVyKRGljTg.text: Decent hotel bar to watch tv and get a middle of the road burger. Bar menu is a bit limited and boring with just flat bread pizzas and burgers/sandwich.  Ahi appetizer on restaurant menu made for a nice light entree.

SwLoAsRDXVG5Jo0-XQce3w.text: This Restaurant is fabulous Matt K is one of the best servers I ever have met..he was very pleasent to have served us...Food I give it a 10 dessert as well. We will def. Will be coming back

fBUQ-toIinR5tubtztXLCQ.text: We were staying at the hotel and decided to call it a night and eat here. Steak was amazing! Sirloin cooked perfect with great seasoning! Best sirloin I've ever had so tender it was like a fillet. Sides were awesome too. Service was spot on!

MscKdO8m5Av4Mojou4oSOw.text: I admit it, the only reason we came here was because we had a certificate from restaurant.com. Usually, places on that site are terrible but we were very pleasantly surprised! We started off with a Cesar and Wedge salads, followed by the bone-in filet. Everything was really good and the meat was perfectly cooked. For dessert, we had the chocolate lava cake which was really good as well. Yea, it's off the strip and people don't like to leave the strip, but this is much better than Cut! Check them out, you won't be disappointed!

Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in filet

sJQFlBAVHOjvr14ZesJzQQ.text: Brunch for $30 a person in Vegas can either be a heavenly steal or a wasted money nightmare in which you find yourself squeezed in between overweight, "starved" tourists wanting to maximize quantity for their buck.  Envy was luckily the former. We were here for brunch on Halloween and enjoyed the atmosphere of regulars being dressed up and mingling in large groups of friends and family.   Brunch here includes unlimited champagne or mimosas - never a good idea when a Russian and a German come in, we will destroy your bubbly supply! Our server caught on soon that we take unlimited to heart and she rapidly refilled our flutes every few minutes. Empty plates were also removed swiftly each time we ventured out to the buffet again. If you don't care for champagne all that much, just go wild at the build-your-own bloody mary bar!  The selection of food was great. It wasn't a mass-appeal kind of buffet, but rather a well-rounded selection of top notch items. The omelet station had any ingredient you could possibly want from jalapenos to applewood smoked bacon. My favorite was the large plate tower of chilled crab legs and shrimp. I was missing my tartar sauce however, I don't care for cocktail sauce.  Envy's carved prime rib is possibly the best one I have ever had. Too bad I targeted the lunch-type food last, I couldn't have more than a slice. I'll save some more space for it next time I'm here.  One thing that gets me to completely ignore calories, carbs and sugar overdoses at buffets are the desserts. Most buffets have those cute little shot glass desserts and I generally take about 10 different kinds until I need to be rolled out of the restaurant. Envy had a smaller than usual dessert selection, but it did not disappoint! The bread pudding topped with raspberries had me zone out until the last crumb was devoured. I'd come back here just for that!  Envy, you make other brunches in Vegas envious with your quality food, excellent service and cozy atmosphere.

f_NScByjEyWn8Y_aXK-pbw.text: I've been here twice for lunch, both times on Saturday and both times almost empty.  The first time was last year and I had a prime filet which was delicious and I loved this place.  I dined again mid-June 2011 and was disappointed.  They no longer offered the filet on the menu, only "steak" options was a New York steak sandwich.  I was not impressed by this sandwich, it was tough.  I upgraded to truffle fries which are truffled reggiano'ed heaven!  I would go here and just eat these.  I guess you have to go at dinner time to get a good steak at ENVY now days.  The service is great--polite and attentive.

u_j7S6p7g_n7St42oaRK4Q.text: We met up with a friend who was in town for business. 4 mixed drinks were $50. While this may be reasonable to some people, I'm local and know where to get more reasonable drinks, so this is a bit high to me.  The stars are still at 3, as the drinks were at least reasonably strong, and we were not searching for a taste of alcohol.

0wxAhZfJnrNwuP84_5zy3A.text: This is for the brunch at Envy... They have a nice Sunday jazz brunch, with a great breakfast buffet.  The classics are there like bacon, sausage, eggs benedict, and create your own omelet, but they also have fancy cheeses, fruits fresh sliced meats, and all you can drink wine or bloody mary's.  I believe you can also order off the menu, but we enjoyed the buffet.  Great meal, with some nice music in the background = perfect morning!  Their dinner is nice also, but I'll save that for another review.

JzPKfGJZk---MdQtrelspg.text: Great ribeye! The Stilton sauce a tasty addition. Caesar salad and wedge both good. Onion soup was a bit bland, needed more onion, but cheese was very good.  Was quiet and enjoyable.  Would return.

NOCVPMmPIr3jwwSUsdSHeg.text: We bought the steakhouse dinner for 2 on groupon. Saved us $50. We had delicious filet mignon and the sides are very generous. The shrimp in the appetizer were huge and the French onion soup was delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp appetizer. Delicious and huge!

p7LLDyfcCCKZL6Z0YfffmQ.text: So my first experience with Envy Steakhouse was great! I loved the place and had to come back, however I am giving this place 4 stars because I was caught in complete surprise when my Caesar Salad came out, it was literally Romaine lettuce on a plate with a HUGE "crouton", the lettuce was not even chopped! So my advice, don't get the Caesar salad because it is something you can put on a plate within 1 minute  I got the Lobster Mac&Cheese as a side and I can honestly say that it was AMAZING!   Despite my bad experience with the Caesar Salad, the service was great, and the atmosphere was nice and calm!

photos.caption: Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cal armor and Shrimp Appetizer
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar Salad

8VQDspHCB4RBVYj9iA8ryw.text: Amazing service and great food! Yes there are better options around the rest of Las Vegas but if you want to go somewhere just off the strip and a little more quiet this is a great place. Very fair prices, New York steak for under 60 dollars, good wine list and a simple but diverse menu. The steak my party ordered was cooked to perfection which is critical regardless of the grade of beef being prepared. Service was incredible and timed the meal perfectly. Came here on a groupon, would definitely go again! Josh was our waiter and he did an excellent job of taking care of the party!

SeDFtWz_Zv-_bM-VdwSkzg.text: They have butchered the entire menu. Not nearly as many options as before. Got rid of all the items I would order. Causing me no reason to go back.

_-hUmIVB3WFYPKOr4QPMRw.text: I LOVE bronzino and if you are a lover too, you also get excited to see it on a menu. I'll caution you on ordering it though... greasy, too salty and overcooked. The two small fillets are hardly worth the price tag.  The sides are large enough for two to share.  The atmosphere is pleasant and the wait staff accommodating and didn't charge me when I expressed my disappointment.

-egXskDojKJu8T5MfZgZmg.text: The exceptional filet was only rivaled by the superior service. I highly recommend this place.

SQJ9VeLrbMWEi57i99adCQ.text: This place is such a hidden gem! The food was really good and our waitress, Stephanie, was so amazing and attentive.  She definitely went above and beyond to make us feel welcome and ensure we're happy.  We had the lobster bisque (pairs amazing with Malbec), crab cakes, filet mignon oscar style, lamb, Truffle fries, creamed corn(the best ever) and cake.  It was all really good.  It was a great night.

photos.caption: Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creamed corn (beware has bacon)
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb

C8XHYs8heyBK0ufovk3Rcg.text: Kristine treated me to this restaurant for my birthday since she knows I love steaks. To get to the restaurant, you have to pass by a fancy looking lobby with this big chandelier, and you know we just had to do a photo op haha. The atmosphere of the restaurant itself is very romantic, definitely a date place, with the dimmed lights and the candles on the table. The waitress was kind and friendly and always checked up on us.  We ordered some appetizers, Black Pepper Calamari and Rock Shrimp and an Oven-Roasted Stuffed Tomato. The calamari was okay, just normal. The stuffed tomato had a really nice presentation, and it tasted really good with the Portobello mushrooms and fennel cream sauce. I ordered the 17oz Bone-In Ribeye, and it was cooked how I wanted it, except for the outside being a little overcooked. It was juicy and flavorful, and I wouldn't mind having it again. Kristine ordered the Pan-Seared Seabass, and I thought its presentation was very well done. The shitake mushrooms and asparagus were a good combination, the truffle butter crust added a nice crunch and flavor, and the port wine reduction sauce added a little bit of a kick, but not too overpowering. We also ordered a side of Truffle-Reggiano Fries, which was a huge serving that could have probably served at least 4 people. It's definitely one of the best truffle fries I've had, though I wish the cheese was melted a bit more. To end our dinner, we ordered Creme Brulee to share, and they were nice enough to add a birthday greeting on the plate.  Overall, a good dining experience. Good food, excellent service, excellent presentation, good atmosphere. I thought the quality of the food could have been better given the expensive prices.

Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
