Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 12oz bone in filet with roasted shallot butter
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Mac n Cheese, Creamed corn and bacon brussel sprouts

cL3Rfpmna5GRIJlCLZIyvA.text: The steaks were very good. We had several different kinds and they were all delicious. The French onion soup was delicious I would recommend this restaurant. The atmosphere was very nice and our waiter was great. However we did have to look for our waiter a couple times when it came to getting our check period but frankly that's a minor complaint

dnc-XvPEJypvF6dYUYVVcQ.text: I've eaten a couple of times here now for business dinners and with friends when I had a Restaurant.com gift certificate. It's no celebrity chef steakhouse on the Strip, but it's a nice place. The space itself is small and nicely appointed. Nothing unique or standout about it, but it is a nice ambiance. And the service has always been great. What I love best here is the filet mignon and truffle mac 'n' cheese. It's cheaper than the Strip places, but in a lot of ways just as good. So if you are hunting for an alternative to a Strip steakhouse, this is a great place to go.

XvF2XYhRFSsaBu-Xd2O8aA.text: I discovered the existence of Envy last summer when looking for a place to have dinner with a bunch of girlfriends during a convention. We ended up at Craftsteak, so I didn't get to try Envy 'til our latest trip to LV this past December. We were armed with one of those Restaurant.com coupons from that fantastic sale, so it was the only place we were interested in dining. Envy is without a doubt one of those hidden gems. It's a secret you want to keep to yourself so you can get a table whenever you like (walk in on a Saturday night, we did), but you know that more people need to know about it lest it go away. So you find the people you love and trust who have never willingly eaten at an Applebee's and you urge them in the strongest words you can to get there and treat themselves. The decor is lovely. Not too busy, not too dull. Full of warm, comforting textures and colors. The service was brilliant. Everyone we interacted with seemed eager and knowledgeable. They were very pleased to see us happy. The food is expertly done. Very rich. Bring a hollow leg, because you won't want to put your fork down. My boyfriend and I shared the tomato soup and spinach salad to start. The portions were moderate, but not so small considering the rest of the meal to come. We each had a filet mignon - perfectly cooked with just salt and pepper and no extra seasonings or sauce. The steak is really just a compliment to the super-rich and super-yummy sides. We had the truffle mashed potatoes (yum!), the bacon and guyere mac&cheese (double-yum!), and the bourbon creamed corn (oh. my. god. and I don't even like creamed corn!). Even though we thought we'd burst, we lingered long enough to order a couple of espressos and desserts. I remember them being excellent as well, but the bottle of Jordan cab was affecting my memory by that point. I cannot remember both of the desserts. One was based on strawberry... I guess I just have to go back to find out what they could have been. Darn!

40yFP2nkgvlMyC8yl9qfHw.text: Awesome awesome experience. Food awesome & service double awsome! Our waiter (Joshua) did a great job informing us on everything & anything. :) He was very friendly and I would love to have him as our waiter again when we go back. and make sure to check out restaurant.com G.C. before you decide to go. it helps. :)

bkPSa86qdElulOAq6QiZCA.text: We went to the Sunday brunch there & while it is a bit pricey, everything was really good.  We especially loved the make your own bloody Mary station.

yezXy9-0nTDtDsdoMAg-dA.text: I had the Envy Signature Burger, a half pound of Angus brilliance.  Per my request, the burger was cooked medium well.  I detected a bit of pepper seasoning on the meat and the white cheddar cheese set the ensemble nicely.  The burger was accompanied by the standard lettuce, tomato and some vegetables I couldn't identify, but lacking a rabbit to feed this detritus to, I left it to the side where it belonged.  The shoestring fries were well-spiced and plentiful.  An excellent side order to a fine burger.  In addition, the Renaissance was generous enough to provide me with a $25 dining credit, so my meal was free.  Comped food always tastes better than paid food.

WXR6sgy4led9bCV2fD6x_Q.text: We had a great experience at Envoy last week celebrating our anniversary. We ordered the seafood tower which was amazing and the "best of both worlds burgers" were out of this world. The wine was a great selection for both courses with a Chilean  Apaltagua un-oaked Chardonnay for the seafood and 2007 Chateau Montelena  cab for the  the filet and lobster.  The food was cook to perfection and our daughter loved her macaroni and cheese. The general manager Ryan and our knowledge attentive waiter Deontae surprised us with a very nice card and warm chocolate cake dessert. The service was excellent. We will back to try the brunch in August.

eOw-8uwQ8azSsVQNYxsMQg.text: We recently had dinner after our wedding at Wynn for a group of 20 in the "Wine Room."  The food was wonderful and the service was amazing.  They worked with us to create a menu that fit our needs and budget.  The chef even came out to greet our guests and cut/serve our wedding cake for us.  We can't wait to come back to Envy for our 1 year anniversary.

8coVwOa23h9Tj3h_bE_8pA.text: Tried Envy based on the ratings that people left.  However, came out feeling disappointed.  First off, we started with the mozzarella caprese.  This was our favorite dish with heirloom tomatoes and their balsamic vinegarette.  Next up, the seafood tower for 2.  Came with 2 King crab legs, 4 tiger prawns, 4 raw oysters, and 4 raw clams.  The entrees were truly UNexceptional.  I ordered the Pan Fried Chilean Sea Bass with crab on top which came with a mushy slimy pile of "wild" mushrooms.  Slightly undercooked and much too greasy for the Sea Bass.  My partner ordered the Rib Eye medium rare.  The outside was charred while the inside was rare-red.  In addition, there was a pool of oil in the middle of the steak.  We sent it back to get a second grilling since it was not medium rare.  The second round came back the same.  Sides included a garlic mashed potato and seasonal vegetables.  The potatos were good while the vegetables were mushy, charred, and came with sprigs of rosemary mixed in.  I ended up having to pick out the rosemary branches like fish bones as they were poking my mouth and unedible.  We also ordered the creamed corn side, which was surprisingly fresh.  All in all, not worth the price.  I'd say order the appetizers and sides, but stay away from the entrees.  In addition, service was pretty shoddy.  Our waiter kept disappearing.  I do however give props to the waiter's assistant.

1sDbznXupRaEwFWty-pDQw.text: My husband and I have been going to Envy for 8 years now. The food is fantastic. The staff is amazing and helpful. I love the atmosphere. The owner came out to congratulate us on our anniversary and brought a card that was signed by the staff. Envy is our anniversary tradition and I don't see that changing any time soon. I've never had a bad experience. Try the truffle fries for an appetizer and the filet mignon for the meal. You won't be disappointed!

wkNlfITpdvn4xRDQoUVd4g.text: I first herd of this steakhouse from some friends that are always looking for a good steak in vegas.  When I first pulled up I saw they had valet right up front which I prefer, not that I am lazy but I hate the long walks threw the casinos mainly because I see the pain my wife is in from those shoes she loves to wear.  The restaurant had a very modern look.  They gave us great recommendations including there amazing split pea soup, which I am not usually a fan of split pea.  My wife had the filet mignon and I had the t-bone, both cooked and seasoned to perfection.  There wine selection was pretty good and the server was excellent at picking a wine for us as well.  The server differently added to the experience not only by his food and wine knowledge but he was encouraging us to coming back soon by informing us of coupons they sometime advertise for locals.  I will be back soon.

dZX1dlFV6wXJ4WpPO2xkzg.text: My friends and I went there based on the great Yelp reviews and Envy did not disappoint.  Our waiter, Joshua, was friendly and made a couple of really good suggestions (go for the chef sauce) our steaks, petite filets and a bone-in rib-eye, were great!  The chef(s?) that night were Mike and Nolan (hope the names are right) and they prepared the food as ordered.  The side dishes were all very good as were the desserts.  Though the restaurant isn't on the Strip, it's not that far from it.  It was very worth the trip!

MQhuKiMKOf90lPjBYdiTxw.text: Artichoke Brie soup sounds weird but this was food to "walk a mile for". Filet could be cut with a fork and service exceptional. Seriously expensive but IMHO worth it occasionally.

Bptk1WvSzbleOrGh8TF86A.text: Wife and I had dinner on our anniversary. They did a great job both with food and making our night special. Todd our server was great.We highly recommend this fine restaurant.

adEW5jh0devC-vhzIruNBg.text: Thought we would try a different steakhouse and was pleasantly surprised.  The service was outstanding as we had Joshua as our waiter.  He was very knowledgeable of the menu and made several great recommendations.  We were celebrating our 10 year anniversary and given glasses of champaign and a card upon arrival.  There is no doubt Joshua loves working for ENVY and making sure his customers receive the best service.  The side dishes were very good and plentiful.  The steak was prepared exactly how I asked, but in comparison to other locations, I wish the steak was served hotter.  The steak was served room temperature..presentation should be as though the steak just got off the grill and served HOT.  Envy gets 5 stars because of their impeccable service as a team!

6hHrcJRDMBtUZ8aydisGGA.text: Great service...had the Bone in Rib Eye...asked for medium rare....but when it came out is was more pink...so if you like medium rare...ask for rare...ehehhehh.... Good streak...but the bone was much thicker like 1.25 inch and the other side of steak was  like 3/4 inch..not very thick or evenly slices...so that changed the cooking time of the steak too.  The steak was a bit blan...but they give you a dish of salts...which can be sprinkled  on the steak before eating it.....make sure u use it.  The sea bass was the best....so buttery and crispy on the outside...melted in your mouth when chewing it, great taste while sitting in a nice display of yellow and green mushroom sauce..so nice and creamy.  There are coupons you can use that cost 40 bucks that will take 100 bucks off ur bill...so use it when you go here....great savings for great price for food.

rXY6eifRJFWESIoL5cH1mA.text: I eat here quite frequently as the Renaissance is favorite for my top execs.   The ambiance is perfect for that deal closer dinner or even a power lunch, I've done both, and the service has been great.  The filet Minion is to die for, I have it med/rare and its cooked perfect.  The wine selection is extensive, and best of all the staff remember your name.    A+++

9kZAwZPS7GLoTZovludVXQ.text: Overall, this was one of my favorite places to entertain business guests. The out of the way, off the strip, location is a relief. The steak and seafood is very good. My low rating is due to a fried cockroach that was mixed in with the pan seared broccoli. My guest screamed. Yes, we received a profuse apology. Yet it still happened I'm a high end restaurant. Complete turn off. Haven't been back.

O3D2gmTKs3dpcdek96X05Q.text: Dark handsome atmosphere. The petite filet was good. The bone in ribeye was cut too thin and was rather bland. The accompanying vegetables were only average. My martini was only average. The wine list is typical distributor's list, full of over priced wines, but a few decent bottles if you hunt. Service is fine.

WXy2xM6jm_YHtOz-fgCh8g.text: Omg so good. My boyfriend and I make sure we visit this place everytime we are in town. I think this past time it was our fourth. I usually get fish as I am not a huge meat eater and my boyfriend always gets a steak. Service was outstanding this time around.

uQx0XlTTUrMKw7RqRx7ElQ.text: Went for Valentines Day.  Had to wait a while even with a reservation. They apologized and gave us free drinks.  I do agree that the bread and butter could use more flavor but other than that the rest was amazing.  We got the crab cakes as an appetizer.  Can i say YUM!  For the entree I had the lamb, which was good, but my boyfriends filet mignon was even better.  Those two entrees came with mashed potatoes and steamed veggies included.  On top of that we got the creamed corn and truffle fries.  This was a lot for the two of us.  We could have got away without truffle fries but we really wanted to try them. ;)

s8vnzpqlmPju8AzTygJ6mQ.text: Went to Envy for the Sunday Brunch.  It was a pleasant surprise.  The selection was smaller due to it being in the steakhouse, but the quality was very good.  The price includes unlimited champagne, mimosas and for Bloody Mary fans, they have a nice make your own Bloody Mary bar.  It was very busy but the service was still good.  Much nicer on the inside than the outside looks.

OiGILPHdv2JeVqNz0Vln0A.text: LOVE their truffle fries. That's a must when you visit. I've been here a few times because I've stayed at the hotel. Their food is yummy, even when you order it late at night. They're quick too. Obviously there isn't many items to choose from when it's late at night, but it's still good. I had the turkey sandwich and salad. The bread was a little too hard, but the salad with their vinegrette was great!  When you go for breakfast, the service is great. Very attentive. They gave us a sample of their smoothie as well. It was pretty good, made only from mixed berries.   I've also been here to hang out at the patio and have some drinks and food. They're pretty attentive and always come by to make sure you're okay.

ExsFEJjQp6r8x6oACc65yg.text: Although I love steak restaurants the sides are usually what brings a smile to my face and stomach.  Envy had everything covered in spades though.  Salad was good...   The rib eye steak was like eating steak flavored butter.. it was perfectly matched with a selection of salts (alderwood smoked was the best).  OH the sides, you could write sonnets on the Bourbon creamed corn (not a dish I would ever order... now I wonder why I can't find it elsewhere). Believe the hype about the truffle fries, I have never EVER taken home fries in a doggy bag... until these fries.  Service was great, personable fast the waitress an her assistant were on EVERYTHING.  We didn't have to wait for refills or more bread or anything.  This made a great meal even better.  I would say that the bartender that served us a drink at the beginning really put me off.  It wasn't busy and his attitude seem to be that we were bothering him.  I was a resident of Las Vegas at the time and since have moved, but my next Vegas trip this will be a destination.

XuKBUsuXVdbH_Yy_Alg10Q.text: I really really don't understand the 5 star reviews. We just went there this weekend (4/11) and although the service was wonderful, the food left so much to be desired. First off, everything was way way too salty. It felt like they literally drenched everything in salt... so while the steak was fairly tender, the crabs came off easily from its shell, I felt like I was eating salt. The creamed corn was crunchy (not expected), the port mushroom was okay and the truffle fries was also salty. I just think everything would've been great had everything was less salty. Save the salt please! I did get the 75 off 150 restaurant.com gift certificate and we did tip off the original amount. Our waiter deserved it (5 stars for service!) but man, I don't know anyone would want to pay for over salted food. Maybe we should have said something.

oopatOb68kvb9ozjzTEpPw.text: I came here for their weekly cult famous Sunday brunch. $24, decent spread, and unlimited wine and mimosas. Yah that last part, I'm sure, was enough to get you alcoholics on board.   There understandably wasn't as big a spread as those at the hotel buffets on the strip, but the food that they did have was pretty decent quality. Pretty damn decent I'd say.  The traditional breakfast foods. The eggs were very well done however the sausage was a bit tasteless.  The omlettes they were making to order seemed to be a big hit (decent wait for them).   The seafood was probably the worst part of the buffet. That's not to say it was bad. It just wasn't too great. They had oysters (great), crab legs (mediocre at best), and shrimp (slightly above-average).   The desserts I didn't have but my friend ate every single dessert she got - she made me take a picture of how clean her dessert plate was.   The best part of everything was the unlimited alcohol in the form of wine and champagne/mimosas.    The whole meal was accompanied by an old dude playing old American beats on a grand piano with something like 30 60+ year-olds clapping along and continuously toasting.    Overall, I'd definitely go back to Envy just for a cheap but good meal, especially if I want to get a headstart towards getting myself plastered.

BBB-AXoEUzoAVW_QgQPvVw.text: One word: YUMMMMMM!!! Went with a $75 restaurant.com cert, off of bill of $151 and it was some of the best food I've ever had. The best steak I think I've ever had (ribeye), best corn EVER (creamed corn), and best fries (truffle parmesan) that I am now drooling just thinking about. Each bite of any of these and I was in complete heaven! Since we had a ton of fries left, I even took them to go and ate them all cold the next morning at the pool - what a breakfast. I think I need to fight the temptation to fly back out to Vegas just to go there again.

Zl5agyH94dwGz_DE_706Ng.text: The truffle fries are way too good. I go with a girlfriend every time we go to Vegas. We get a coupon from restaurant.com and cab it over. It is nice to be in the one spot without slot machines. The ambiance is quiet and comfortable. Our service has been outstanding. The filet mignon was perfect and my friend's lobster practically disappeared. She said her scallops on a previous visit were the best she has ever eaten. The wine and drinks were done well. We will return, we have loved without reservation each visit. Good date restaurant.

JizWxCNdqs2Dsi76KMCp5A.text: Had a nice experience taking a customer here for lunch.  Service was good and the each one of us enjoyed what we ordered.  Comfortable seating with an enjoyable atmospherre.  I would definitely recommend this restaurant to others.

0cTpJnhWYwtoMMab0ptluA.text: Try the "Lady Fafa" martini..yuuuummmyy!!  Okay it's taken me sooo long to write this review..but let me tell you.  We had a great opportunity to sample most things on the menu, including the lamb, the ribeye, the sea bass with the truffle butter and almost all the sides.  Very good..EXCELLENT service..the sous chef came out to greet us and tell us about our dinner.  He was very kind and generously spent time with us.  We love our night out at Envy.  Perfect for a romantic night or a fancy business dinner.

h15HpE1_XWcHshFWbPWoNA.text: Six of us enjoyed a delicious dinner at Envy.   Chilled asparagus soup with creme fraiche was a surprise hit.  Three of us had fish and three of us had steak.  They definitely know how to cook a steak medium rare.  I craved the chocolate walnut bread but they were out so serving a different bread but as soon as they learned how disappointed I was they returned with the last few slices for me.  i was so thrilled.  It's that type of service that makes the difference when there are so many restaurants to choose from on the strip.  Also, don't miss out on the parmesan truffle fries.  Joshua was our server on our first visit so I asked for him this time as well.  He didn't disappoint - my friends felt he made the dining experience enjoyable and agreed the service was impeccable.

2KDlIghoyP8UoCkmBbAQhw.text: I would've never heard about Envy if restaurants. com wasn't doing the 80% off coupon specials for this place. I guess for the locals, this is one of their favorite steak houses off the strip. It is a bit aways from the strip on Paradise Ave. Fortunately I was driving, I manage to find the Renaissance hotel and this place.   The parking and walking from the car part definitely was an adventure. The restaurant was buried way in the corner of the lobby and the best part was there were no signs that tell us how to get there. I guess I got spoiled by all those other casinos on the strip. Would be nice if there was a post it note on side of a beam some where..but oh well.   I came here right when they opened up at 5pm for dinner service. We had a very friendly waiter that didn't give us the dirty look because we were planning on using the restaurants .com coupon. Since we didn't have a huge appetite, we decided to share off the prix-fixe menu. Apparently thats a huge no no and its designated for one person. So we ended up getting the Envy signature bone in steak and a side of 3 cheese mac and cheese.   The appetizer arrived close to 30-45 mins after our order. I wasn't too annoyed since I wasn't hungry, and we got time to conversate and enjoy the decor at this place. They also gave us some bread with butter to munch on while they were firing up the grills.   The steak finally came split in two, and they creatively added some decor to the plate for both of us. I thought that was nice on their part since we were sharing and that we each got our own dinner plates. The mac and cheese came in a bowl on its own. I would say for $10, it was a very small bowl. The steak tasted wonderful, and not over cooked since I ordered it done medium well. Meat is meat, its all up to how much you cook it and how the flavor is. I would give them an A+ on the steak. The mac and cheese on the other hand had this funky odor. Probably smelled like some wet socks after football. Not to mention that it was way too salty. I could barely chew on the mac and cheese without crunching on another granulate of salt. Someone went crazy with the shaker in the back.  Either ways, we only had to pay half the price with our restaurant's .com discount. Next time we will definitely go with a $50 off $100 coupon so we can get a bunch of leftovers for the suite.  I will definitely pay Envy another visit.

Oku351W-VzY6oF2WIhEIeA.text: Hooray for Envy! We hit Envy after a long day of many pineapple mojitos & shots, and no food at the pool. Generally this combo would put me straight to bed, but on this particular night I rallied, and thank goodness I did! With the four of us piled into a 1998 Camry (only the classiest while staying at the Wynn) we rolled up to the Envy for what is has become one of the more memorable dinners I've done in recent times. We started with the chilled seafood platter for 2 - try for 6. We had a tough time finishing this but somehow we managed. Somewhere in there a salad with some goat cheese was passed around. So rich, it should have been dessert. My husband and I shared the bone-in filet while our partners in crime both had petite filets. The bone-in was ah-ma-zing. Juicy, perfectly cooked... I am drooling thinking about it. The creamed corn was a perfect side for this meal. We did wine, we did dessert, and we did espresso. We also did a $75 restaurants.com gift certificate and I made it through the meal without passing out. Winner-Winner-Winner!

DkY1jvTPsQLrmge6reGxfg.text: My wife and I went to Envy for my Birthday Dinner with great expectations but left disappointed.  We started with a completely flavorless onion soup and a so-so spinach salad. Skipped the appetizers and had the 'signature' bone in rib eye that again was completely flavorless. It was cooked a perfect medium but there was no flavor, no great tenderness, nothing that stood out. I had it topped Oscar style which was nice and added the only flair.  My wife had the Sea Bass which was served over wild mushrooms and topped with Crab Victoria. The fish was perfect as were the mushrooms. The crab was seasoned with Thyme and Rosemary which was just awful and took away from the fish. She added the butter poached king crab which again was seasoned, this time with parsley which again took away from the clean flavor the the crab and while I have had butter poached lobster before, the crab did not taste like anything had been done other than boiling.   The only high point were the sides. We shared the Creamed corn and the bacon and Gruyere mashed potatoes. Both were perfect.  Service was very good as well but we will not be making a return trip.

dxg2Z-uAD1BMVi6WETX3MQ.text: This place never disappoints.  Professional & friendly staff with a chef getting some work done in the back.  I love this place.  The only thing they can do to make it better is add 24oz bone in rib eye.  Thanks for the good times Envy.

lK6CQarDSa54tXTvqeS5FQ.text: A place to have a cocktail and a great dinner. The chef and staff will go out of there way to make sure your dinning experience is one of the best.

F-Rqp3ONzcWmPghL49WGUg.text: We bought a living social coupon for $40 for $80 worth of food and decided to give ENVY a try.  It was a Monday night at 6pm and the place was empty except one other couple.  Or waiter, Joshua, could not have been more pleasant, helpful and just  genuinely nice.  The complimentary bread was delicious and warm and fresh.  We ordered the wedge salad and the Caesar salad - both very fresh and pretty.  There were three of us and one of our friends can't eat much and Joshua had no problem bringing and extra plate so she could share our salads.  My hubby ordered the ribeye and he said it was delicious!  I ordered the New York steak and again, my friend and I wanted to share.  We had a table discussion about how to cook it as I like mine more well done than hers.  Joshua solved the problem by suggesting the steak be cut in half and each cooked separately.  Brilliant!  We ordered the creamed corn - and it was fabulous!  Definitely a high lite.  The lobster mac and cheese was good too with chunks of lob.  All through the meal the service was excellent.  When we paid two credit cards were used to split the Bill.  Again no problem.  We then said our goodbyes to Joshua and spent 10 minutes using the hotel restroom and goofing around taking pictures in the hotel lobby which was gorgeous.  As we walked out the door, up pulled the valet with our car, right as we stepped outside.  We had not turned our valet ticket in.  It was perfectly orchestrated so our car was there as we stepped outside.  All we can imagine is that Joshua got our last names off our credit cards and arranged for the valet to get our car!  We were so amazed at the perfect timing and it made us feel special.  All in all a great experience.  This hotel and restaurant are right next to the convention center.  Joshua told us that when the conventions are in town - totally different atmosphere - and they are packed.  No convention = quiet restaurant and low priced room costs.  So check the LV convention calendar.  We might stay at this beautiful hotel in the future when there is no convention - we checked and the rate was $109.  Great restaurant and cool atmosphere.  And Joshua is the best!!!

Pb0VKfQlGQo1p3UvcwQbbw.text: The menu lacked variety. Overpriced. Quality of the steaks were mediocre. The bread taste like it has been sitting there for the whole day. The butter was flavorless. None of the sauces that came with the steaks tasted good. I'd rather use the salt they provided. The best item on our table was the cream corn. Generous portions on the steaks, but I prefer quality over quantity. Will not get a repeat visit from me.

QgRNs_l6ICrFbo8kh2eHiw.text: Out at Consumer Electronics Show two weeks ago. I made reservations here for 3 days and Envy was great. great lunch and great staff gave my team a great break from the chaos of the show. The burger is pretty good.

_y7KXBmniUsGjutgx_G5ag.text: This place was OK. I think they were overwhelmed by the convention lunch business.

tgscliou2qEi3IfaCMLXFg.text: Best dining experience in my life!  Chef's special were exquisite!  Very romantic and upscale.  If you want bold and unique flavors, your mouth will have orgasms at this restaurant.  Staff was super friendly. Perfect location for any celebration!

h_esDe3rYAjpRdOmc9MMJQ.text: Got invited here for lunch while attending SEMA show across at the convention center.  This place is awesome. Had the shrimp flatbread essentially a pizza rectangle shape. Best Ive ever had... Memorable and will go back next time in vegas!

By1_nKyvZoaO3lM9EjeJ6w.text: Wonderful place for fine dining right in the Reneccance hotel Las Vegas!!! Excellent food and service! Living social has a great deal $40 for $80 so invest in that app. As for the meal one word "perfection"!!!! Steak was to die for as well as the sides! I wool be coming back ambiance was very romantic and inviting! The hotel is really beautiful as we'll!

photos.caption: Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy!
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Out meal, and it was only $40 with the living social coupon! Oh and you can make reservations!

HFwmBQT0MY8hn3W7bpjPkw.text: Delicious!   We got a Living Social deal $30 for $80 worth We had the calamari to start, our entrees were the  salmon and the steak and our sides were creamed corn and parmesan fries. Everything was delicious! Our cups were always full, the staff was very nice and attentive. We ended up paying $42 after the Living Social deal was applied. A little pricey but well worth what you pay. The fries are a must!

qYMdeHJNCqsO0TNLA8LQNQ.text: As good as it gets!  Service superb and wonderful people providing it.  I've been here several times and i'm always impressed.  Fillet, sea bass, rack of lamb all wonderful.  If they gave Burger King the recipe for their truffle parmesan french fries McDonalds would be out of business.

C_ox9ymaNFv4P9OT4Yph-Q.text: Respectable meat joint tucked away in the lobby of the Renaissance Hotel, somewhat outside of the usual tourist corridors yet worth the trek if you're craving a good steak at a price that won't devastate your budget. That's not to say this is budget fare; an average cut plus sides and a couple glasses of wine can set you back well over $100 per person. I've been to better, but this steakhouse's more casual-hip ambience and quick service deserves a try. Tip: look on TravelZoo or other websites for bargain coupons before making your reservation.

HiK39vTzYinIKSvfzuEXkw.text: Not worth the price. I got the 8oz fillet, garlic mashed potatoes, spinach and a bottle of Toscana. The sides and wine were fine, but the "star" of the show failed to deliver. The fillet very tender but was dry and overcooked.  Another thing thing that bugged me were the steak knives.  They looked like they were bought second hand and kicked down the street. They were rough looking.

xcDK4oYfJKuvxx49Ay3xQw.text: This place is inside of the Renaissance Hotel.  The ambiance of the restaurant is very nice, however, the music was just OFF.  During the time I was the they only played what I'd consider night club music.  It just didn't go with the decor of the restaurant which I felt was quite classy.  I ordered a shrimp cocktail as an appetizer.  This was extremely delicious and was accompanied with a nice avocado mousse.  For my main dish I had the bone-in rib eye steak which was extremely juicy and full of flavor.  It came with garlic mashed potatoes which could have used a little more garlic and been a little more creamier and brussel sprouts which were cooked to perfection and seasoned with the bacon...YUMMM.  We also ordered bourbon creamed corn which was cut right off the cob, and was quite tasty.  For dessert, I had their New York cheese cake.   This was not a good choice at all.  The graham cracker crust was as dry as the desert of Vegas, and the cheese cake itself didn't have much flavor and was also quite dry.  All in all, this was a very good experience.  I was blessed to have a coupon from Living Social ($40 for $80) that helped with the premium cost.  This would be a great place if they adjusted the music to the environment and addressed the issue with my dessert (desert).  Because of these elements I give this place 4 stars, but don't let that missing star stop you from going here...This place is excellent.

qbQjPU1ezylx42GOq_tIiA.text: Porterhouse steak was cooked perfectly medium and was big enough to split.  The pomme frite was great.  The service was exceptional, our waitress went out of her way to give us bar tips for the evening, and we hopped to each one after dinner.

s6cPQfRLMtfWM86OaPhKQg.text: My husband and I were celebrating the end of summer and decided to come to Envy. We had a living social coupon for it and thought it would be nice. The decor of the restaurant was elegant and beautiful. The music was light jazz...rat pack songs. Our waiter, David, was extremely polite and friendly. We ordered two filet mignons, the creamed corn and the truffle fries. It was all so delicious. The filet mignon was so tender and the flavor was outstanding...one of the best steaks I've eaten in a long time. The sides were amazing!! David, really outdid himself. He brought us a sample of the salad...yummy and other sides. He also brought a trio of desserts...heavenly. I highly recommend this restaurant. Ask for the chef's table to get a look at the kitchen...clean and fun!! Ask for David...he's awesome!!

UKGxNmtKX2YdqxP6RHDh3Q.text: We went here to celebrate my birthday, and we had the nicest time. We ordered the scallop, the chicken, lobster bisque, lobster Mac n cheese, bourbon cream corn, mushroom, carrot cake and the chocolate cake. We LOVE everything, the food was delish, the staff was nice and the place is so nice and comfy. We would be back to celebrate special occasion again for sure.

10clZ7nMye7FPMmi1LYZqA.text: Wonderful dinner experience tonight...Manager on duty, our server Joshua, Chef Carlos and rest of the staff made our visit extra special!  Chef made sauteed clams for my daughter which is not in the menu...Calamari and Rock Shrimp, Whiskey Cream Corn, Lobster Mac n Cheese, Mushroom Medley, garlic Mash, Truffle Fries and super Tomahawk were all so yummy.  Great service, great food...perfect night!

photos.caption: Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kNTPOwrSfCo7fc0mqUvnXw.text: The steak tasted pretty good, but i wish it came with fee sides without paying extra.   Truffle parmesan fries was to die for. Two people could definitely share a half portion, otherwise you are going to feel so guilty you won't wanna take another bite of fries in the next 3 months!

photos.caption: Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Parmesan Fries... wow!!

T51mu7VHBxinw0gIzhD2-w.text: Came here on a living social coupon. Overall experience was okay. I had called before hand to make a reservation and they told me that the restaurant would not be busy and that i didn't need one. When I get to the restaurant, they asked if I had reservations. I replied no and they did a "it's okay" in a manner like we forgive you. Not the best hostess response.   On to the food, I went there with a friend and we both wanted the ribeye. Unfortunately there was only one left. You would think that a steakhouse wouldn't run out of steak, especially on a non busy night. The actual food itself was very tasty. The lobster mac and cheese was by far the best dish of the night. Not sure if it is worth it to go again.

kW1nUWs1c1IViV05wbSy6g.text: Wonderful meal with exceptional service by David. I was traveling solo for work and he was friendly and very helpful in helping me select my dinner. I will definitely return.

e8L8nvB3fGSo2HC3kV-XSQ.text: Hidden gem off the strip.  Easy parking, great service and outstanding food.  You can also find deals on LivingSocial or Groupon once in awhile to save a little $$.  We keep coming back, great meal and experience every time.

3g_s4bqrKsoFF59DVaoBhw.text: It was July 4, and we wanted to enjoy a nice meal before hitting the town. What's more convenient then dinning at your hotel?   I made reservations for the Chefs table which gives you a great view of the chefs in action. We had some yummy appetizers and cocktails upstairs at the club lounge before heading to the restaurant.   I tried the 17 oz bone in rib eye which came with the garlic mashed potatoes and medley of roasted mixed veggies. The steak was cooked to perfection and was delicious. Garlic mashed potatoes also excellent - buttery and garlicky but not overbearing. The veggies were decent and complimented the meal. Envy offers three types of salts which go great on your steaks and sides. Envy offers a 14 oz bone in Fillet which i tasted and it was awesome too!   The staff here is friendly and the head chef even introduced himself. He also took the time to follow up and make sure we were totally happy!

Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chefs Table view
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in Ribeye, garlic mash, veggies

3S7ozjGGKfzYECQ2TajYLQ.text: Came here for breakfast and the service was really slow. I ordered the steak and eggs and had to send the steak back twice because it was overcooked. You would think a steakhouse would be able to grill a steak right. It's a very nice restaurant and the staff is nice but for what you're paying, it was pretty bad.

izJAkQ95BzrfRhhxRFf4-A.text: This restaurant and the hotel it is in should be avoided because of their terrible business practices.  I purchased a Groupon for this restaurant and followed all of the rules of the Groupon, including calling weeks in advance and making a reservation and mentioning my Groupon.  When I showed up with my date on the evening of my reservation, the restaurant manager and the hotel manager both refused to honor my Groupon, and stated that they just weren't honoring Groupons anymore.  This was on January 7, 2017 and my Groupon had an expiration date of April 12, 2017.  They acknowledged that I had made a reservation and that they had it in their system, and that I had mentioned my Groupon when I made the reservation.  They first said that they would not honor the Groupon because there was a convention in Las Vegas that weekend, and they don't honor Groupons when there is a convention in town.  I pointed out that the date was not excluded anywhere in the fine print on the Groupon.  Then they said they just were not honoring Groupons at all anymore.  When I politely pointed out that they had no right to refuse to honor my Groupon, and that they had taken my money when I bought the Groupon and owed me the "5-Course Gourmet Tasting Dinner for 2 People" that I had purchased, they flatly refused to honor it and they actually called security and made my date and me leave the hotel.  They did not provide me with a refund of the money I had paid for the meal.  I can't imagine a worse experience, and I will never go to this restaurant or to any Renaissance Hotel ever again.  They rip off their customers and take their money selling a voucher and then refuse to honor it.  The worst kind of business.

EvrjaKg70D7uVzJJGOHluA.text: Envy of who????  Came here on a Friday night and no one was in the place.  Our group of six guys ordered a round of some very tasty martinis and bread was brought to the table, we had heard great things and expectations were high. We ordered lamb chops and steaks and waited about an hour and a half for them to come out.  On arrival the lamb chops were just okay and the steak found to be overcooked. Our server "Devante" or something similar was not too enthusiastic and seemed to be either new to the place or distracted, we didn't see him often and he did very little to make the experience an enjoyable one. Overall the place isn't worth the money and the trip off of the strip.  The Steakhouse in Circus Circus "of all places" is nearby and much better

SZpDh08GGe0uazOEhSsfjQ.text: We had a memorable experience the previous time when we visited Envy Steakhouse.  Chef Carlos actually came out and greeted us after we complemented him on his fine cooking skill and we promised to come back when we are in town.  Our server was excellent and super attentitve.  What the difference a year made!  Fast forward to 2016 New Year Eve, we braved the hectic 5:00p traffic and drove from Red Rock Casino to Envy Steakhouse, AFTER the receptionist confirmed our reservation and ASSURED us our Groupon would be honored.  We specifically asked about the Groupon clarification because it did not list any restrictions for holidays use.   And we could have gone to Fleming's Steakhouse on Charleston which is only a few blocks away from the casino.   Such a big disaapointment and a sense of betrayal when the manager at Envy Steakhouse said he was sorry that they had made a mistake and then just walked away.  Obviously we did not dine at the restaurant.  We contacted Groupon immediately to cancel our purchase and the full amount was refunded promptly on the spot since we dont want to have anything to do with Envy Steakhouse anymore.  Groupon also cannot find any listed restrictions or limitations in their record for their Envy Steakhouse promotional agreement.  I am just so happy my last bad restaurant experience ended on the new year's event  !!

aZWw_Yn1Zx9IauThh5es9Q.text: Although this restaurant is a bit off the beaten path, my friend and I had a wonderful meal. The dining area is inside the Renaissance Hotel, it was very comfortable and very nicely decorated.   He said his prime sirloin was cooked to perfection. Even though he normally orders a steak without sauce, he said it was amazing. The mashed potatoes, brussel sprouts and dinner rolls were outstanding as well. He said his steak was the best he's ever had.   My Sea Bass was also terrific. The fish was very tender having the most delicate outside crunch.  I loved the baby asparagus that came with it.  We received a lot of attention with regards to water and bread refills. The waiter, Matt, was very friendly and a great waiter.  The only negative was the Creme Brulee. It was too runny and the sugar was close to being burned. The sugar had a burnt after taste.

TM8X5mZEbInpqNrm6Bjt1Q.text: My friend said they went to this restaurant and said it was good & told me about a Groupon etc. I'd been seeking a decent steakhouse in Vegas. We ordered the Caesar salad which btw comes with additional items in case you have issues -capers, hard boiled eggs, & a sliver of anchovy & I had the Caprese salad w/red onions, filet mignon($54) another steak ($56) side of truffle french fries (huge portion two of us didn't make a dent!). We got the chocolate cake w vanilla ice cream & cheescake w fresh berries and berry sauce-it was very soft and tasty-couldn't finish it. Overall with our server "Josh" at the helm, we had a very pleasant and delicious dinner. Made the freckles downtown LV from Summerlin so that says a lot lol. I'm a local and he told me about the Chef trying out new items sometimes so hope to come back for that. Don't forget to tip on the prove of device was amazing. I usually aim for 20%. Excellent service & team work by the floor staff so is go back in the future.

Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $10 Valet or $7 (1-4 hrs) self parking.
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My guests steak, he asked for medium well and it was pretty well done but we were starving so he ate it.

nkzRyToIOY61Ptmav562Zw.text: Had a nice family of 4 meal.  Crab cakes were weak.   Filets were done the right way and near Morton's type quality.  French fries good.   It's a corporate hotel looking nice restaurant.  Nothing super special.  If you go only go with coupon.   One thing that was upsetting was you pay for parking at a hotel way off the strip.  Whatever.   I ate for well over half off regular prices and even at that I think it was just a fair price.     I will say my wife had the sea bass which she eats regularly and said it was thick and done perfectly.  The best she has had in Vegas.   So if you like fish that wouldn't be a bad option.

HMFvJ7O_iOrHBbN0slGy5Q.text: This could've been the best groupon experience yet. Some businesses cringe/shun you when you tell them you have a Groupon. This was not the case. From the moment we made the reservation to the moment we sat down at the restaurant we felt welcome. Great experience. It's a little off the beaten path but if you get a chance give it a try.

photos.caption: Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KgDqbpOdvt9TFCxtBv9EXQ.text: We decided to stay at the hotel and have dinner at Envy Steakhouse. Our waitress, Stephanie, was excellent and even brought us some of the delicious asparagus on the house. The food was great and the service even better . The chef, Carlos, even made a special dessert that wasn't on the menu, but made to what we wanted. We would definitely come back again even if we weren't staying at the hotel.

7sNJM3a3rU39xush7QO1MA.text: We went last night for restaurant week and got the filet with crab cakes, mashed potatoes, asparagus, wedge salad and the New York Cheesecake! Everything was delicious!   And Micheal, the host, was so considering! He sat us in a cozy corner booth and I was a little cold becuaseI had forgotten my sweater.   He offered to bring me a blanket and even sent us a glass of champagne!   Wonderful time at Envy Steakhouse!!!    Will be back again!!!

photos.caption: Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy Crab Cakes!!!
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The New York cheesecake is flown in from Juniors every 2 days from NYC!!!

LiWJmPPriH0eqBXVSZ7fFQ.text: Food was good and service great. Unless you are using a Groupon it's very over priced. Did not line the dessert choices at all.

Lhex5oyzhQVlsO1Ghmnm9w.text: We loved this place. For being inside the Renaissance hotel, (not saying anything bad about the place- but definitely not a Vegas top favorite of hotels), we were pleasantly surprised by the ambiance and quality of the food and service.   There are a lot more pros than cons. Everything we ordered (bourbon creamed corn, asparagus, calamari/rock shrimp, crab cakes, porterhouse steak, Chilean sea bass, chocolate cake, and two cocktails) was delicious. Our server David was attentive and gave good recommendations. The restaurant itself is pretty nice with classy and clean decor. We highly recommend the crab cakes, calamari, and bourbon creamed corn. Although my sea bass was amazing. The portions were perfect.   For the cons... they aren't too bad at all but worth mentioning. The bread they serve in the beginning came our pretty hard and cold (reviewers stated theirs being hot and soft), our "calamari and rock shrimp" appetizer came with no shrimp, my boyfriends steak was pretty tough to eat towards the middle (but the rest of it was great), the restaurant itself is really cold (maybe just the time we went), and although they do have a full bar- there was no cocktail menu. I feel like most restaurants in Vegas (especially steakhouses) have a specialty drink menu. I wanted to order a carajillo but their espresso machine was broken- so I ordered a plain vodka soda.   The prices are very reasonable. We used a nice Groupon for this meal. We calculated the prices and our total for two entrees, two appetizers, two sides, two cocktails, and one dessert would've been about $175 before tax. Not bad at all   Still happy with this place overall... but the little things jus brought it down to 4 stars rather than 5.

photos.caption: Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 24 oz porterhouse steak
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asparagus

4jRSq2nryZoq5jH0mpxyaQ.text: Excellent service. Servers  always remember us when we arrive.  Treat us great. Food  very very good. Atmosphere very nice.  Upscale place to grab a perfect steak or other. Unexpected surprise off Fremont street. Recommend you all try this restaurant

M_Z218Wyxu0y3g8Xwj5dyw.text: Our group makes it a point to visit when we are in town. Chef Carlos makes one of the best filets around. Stephanie and Marcos provide top notch service and Joe the bartender makes the BEST Hendricks Gin Mule.

LnRhh8NjtBAaWG30D8fxKQ.text: Absolutely loved our experience here! We had the dinner for two with drinks Groupon, but the staff treated us like VIPs from the minute we checked in for our reservation. We ordered the French onion soup, pan seared jumbo lump crab cake, filet mignon, Chilean sea bass (which my boyfriend won't stop talking about), and garlic broccolini, all of which we were quite happy with. The real treat, however, were the truffle fries. They were beyond delicious, and I've NEVER seen such a generous serving at a higher-end restaurant. Our only minor complaints about the food (hence the 4 stars instead of 5) were that the $free bread they brought to the table didn't seem fresh at all, their Bearnaise sauce was a touch too acidic, and the French onion soup wasn't the most spectacular I've had.   The service was impeccable-- everyone was incredibly friendly and attentive. We told our server we were celebrating my boyfriend's work promotion, and he comped the extra cocktail and side we had added to the bill on top of the Groupon!  All-in-all, I'd say this restaurant is worth the price, with or without a Groupon--we've eaten at considerably more expensive steakhouses that were not as enjoyable as this one. We will definitely be returning!

ypfR4uE2sTDwvcNMzoVHyQ.text: Absolutely awful experience! I am a Marriott Platinum Elite member and have been to this restaurant in prior years. We decided to try it out again for a special occasion but the entire evening was ruined.   Prior to arriving we noticed that there was a Travelzoo deal saving a little bit of money so we decided on purchasing it. We arrived to the restaurant for our 645pm reservation and were seated within minutes. It took a little while for the waiter to come out but when he did he explained the menu and we ordered.   For appetizers we got the lobster bisque and caesar salad. It took about thirty minutes for them to come out. The lobster bisque was very flavorless and not even warm. Then came time for waiting...and more waiting...and even more waiting. After another forty minutes we notified the server that we had a show to catch and that we would need the deserts to go. He said he would check on the food.   Our two filet mignons came out about another ten minutes after he went to check on them. One was cooled great, the other not so much. It was not medium rare not was it even warm! I was served a room temperature steak that I'm assuming was just sitting out waiting to be served. We tried to get the waiter's attention but he was no where to be found as was most of the night.  Once again we waited...then waited some more. Eventually we told a different server to just take everything away and in form our server. A few minutes later our server came out and said he could make me a fish pretty fast since the steak wasn't cooked right. I explained once again to him that we had a show to catch so he said he would bring the bill.  Next the manager came out and told us the bill would be taken care of. We explained to him that we paid for the voucher and they decided to already redeem it so its not like he was doing us any favor. He then asked if he could cover some drinks on our way out or take down our info for next time. As we are moving out of the country in a few days that has no use to us nor did we want to take time to order drinks while we were running late to a show.  Overall horrible experience and their service has definitely downgraded over the years. We wasted our time and money, and worst of all still left hungry after eating just a soup.

photos.caption: Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lYFwDN9PCl7eNBe7d-pckA.text: From last week visit... Experience was excellent Major our server was magnificent I had the best steak w a blue cheese crust prepared to a perfect med rare prices are ok for the venue . The lobster macaroni and cheese is tasty but good luck finding Nemo...lol I  mean the  lobster  In general if you add cab fare or $10 vatet plus tip it may not be that ok of a deal Even hotel guests pay for valet .. The new era of greedy hotels charging resorts fees plus valet... But that is not on the ENVY STEAK HOUSE.

WZltx4CU4bGVaQqr1z1NkQ.text: I will say 4.5 stars for Steven, the chef, Carlos the general manager and John , our waiter. All total professionals and a joy.   Wonderful tasting menu with wine. Came back 2 nights later and had a really superb pan fired chicken ! They can cook. Well worth the trip .

RYqYPRxNaSl-i5DHjDH2vg.text: Excellent food. Service was amazing mynor our server was knowledgeable and has great suggestions. Prices are reasonable and food tasted amazing. The drinks were delicious and appetizers were plentiful. First time here a bit from the strip but worth the drive definitely will return.

photos.caption: Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front entrance
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wedge salad and lobster bisque. Strawberry daiquiri and margarita

W_YuwY5RZg7kNPG2tpZtcg.text: Wow, this was BY FAR the WORST experience I have had at a "steakhouse" EVER.   1. The place was empty and the server took forever to come to the table and acknowledge our party of four. 2. We had to ask other servers for water, CLEAN silverware, and condiments that you would normally find on the table such as (salt, pepper and steak sauce)  3. The steaks had NO FLAVOR and they were DRY. I order my steak RARE and even that was a sad excuse for human grade food.  4. We had to ask for the check several times and even the Manager was a ghost the entire night.  5. The WORST service I have EVER had!  There is so much more I can write but just the thought of this restaurant is making me upset and lose my appetite.   Please EVERYONE looking for a quality restaurant DO NOT choose this one! Save your money as Sizzler or Denny's have better quality

nTCqtayFlvKB_6ST996d1Q.text: This is only reviewing the wine and deserts as that was all that I got. The customer service is good, the pours are generous and the chocolate flourless torte was VERY good! It's clean and modern.

omRLCsjjZT7RL5O4h6xTrg.text: This is the BEST steakhouse in Las Vegas. Our waiter Major was EXCELLENT one of the best servers we've had. It's super close to the strip and easy access to get to by Uber or even driving yourself. The atmosphere is excellent and the food is AMAZING with great portions. I also have a food allergy which the server MAJOR and the chef were very helpful and accommodating with changing the entrees into something for myself. I got the shrimp cocktail, Sea bass and asparagus  the cocktail sauce had wasabi in it which gave it an excellent zest. And the shrimps were HUGE. My fiance got the crab cakes, filet mignon, and cheesecake. The filet mignon is the best he's ever had! If you live close by or are visiting this is a great spot. We went for our anniversary and were not disappointed, we were also treated with a complimentary flute of champagne for our anniversary. We felt very welcome here and the vibe is great you will love it!

photos.caption: Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Champagne compliments of server for our anniversary
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp cocktail. Shrimps are HUGE and cocktail sauce has wasabi, adding a great flavor
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seabass cooked dairy free(personal allergy)

5OF6dP4eBv0P0fMGKMD41A.text: Generally I take hotel restaurants with a grain of salt (pardon the pun!), as the food often does not align with the price.  Envy, however, is quite different in my mind.  The steaks we had were top notch!  Side dishes, too were innovative and delicious.  Our server, Joshua, was pretty much the best that I've ever had... he was attentive, offered great suggestions, came by at perfect intervals, showed up with courses at the perfect moment, and was a great conversationalist.   This truly was a wonderful experience & meal.

LnxbByyhrmyOPGXJKQqZNg.text: I'm torn on 3-4 stars. There was Groupon for 2 and my husband had wanted to have a nice steak so we decided to try it out. We made reservations but our show got out sooner so we headed over and arrived about 20 minutes early and they wouldn't seat us until our reservation time.  The food was amazing but I felt like the waiter didn't pay much mind to us and even more so because we were using a Groupon. After we paid our bill and the waiter brought back our card he actually talked to us a little and when we told him we were locals he gave us his card and apologized for not being more available and we should come back and see him. I don't think we will be returning.

dXmDd48_56abJUsrWnb_pw.text: Since we stayed in the hotel, we decided to have a late dinner. Our server was Joshua, very accommodating and he will cater to your needs from choosing the right wine, appetizers selections and of course "best Steak". The Chef and Emon surprised us in so many ways. I think this was one of the best customer service I've ever had plus the excellent food..Thank you everyone for making our stay memorable.
