1YaeWDVFR0SgvP29IpZMXQ.text: The service is definately a 5 star all the way around.  The food was very good, the chicken marsala amazing.  The rib eye awesome, best mashed potatoes I have ever had; we will def

5Sno0xX57zaz77sQwBhnqw.text: My husband and I went to this restaurant for brunch based on everyone recommendation of this place.  Not worth going.  The only thing that was worth eating from the brunch buffet was the chicken noodle soup.  I ordered the hamburger and truffle french fries.  I expect the hamburger to be phenomenal but sadly it was not, the beef taste like meat gone bad.  It's sad that a steakhouse who charge $29 for a burger couldn't even do it right.  Conclusion? Feed your palate and conserve your doll at La Village brunch at Paris.

AGIKdKEYgohHdi0QMHSx4A.text: Finally tried this restaurant after talking about eating here for years... Came to Vegas for my birthday with a group of friends to celebrate and decided to stroll in around 9 PM. We were all starving from all the partying that we had done that day. The decor of the place was very nice and was somewhere you could take a date on. The wine list was decent and wine prices were fairly decent. We ordered Calamari for appetizer which was nothing special. The green sauce that was served with the calamari was very interesting. Not sure if it was in a good way or not. Then came the steak! We ordered 6 Bone In Ribeyes along with garlic mashed potatoes and lobster mac and cheese. The ribeye was cooked rare with some parts that looked completely raw (I had ordered it medium rare). The beef was very tender and veryyy juicy. Me and my friends all agreed that about half way through it, it was seasoned VERY salty. Half of us couldn't finish the steak because of the saltiness. The mash potatoes weren't much to rave about but the lobster mac & cheese was pretty special. Overall the meal was okay... If it wasn't for my restaurant.com coupon, I would have been severely disappointing. Not sure why the reviews on here were so good...

j5SlUMW8Rjnro5UFCMG0CA.text: ENVY was the best meal we had in Vegas.  We both ordered the Signature Tasting Entree:  Filet Mignon, Braised Beef Cheeks, Sea Bass, and Crab Victoria.  The beef cheeks made us nervous, but turned out to be excellent.  Very rich.  The sea bass was average (Bonefish's is better!) the filet was good as well, although the bearnaise was ice cold when we were served, and by the time some lukewarm bearnaise came, my steak had lost all warmth.  (And PS - I know that you can't make bearnaise too hot!)  The crab victoria I don't remember because I was on my third glass of wine :-)  Also, enjoyed a mix-and-match flight of wine for $12.  The service was shotty, which is why I gave it a 4 out of 5.  ENVY was a good experience all-in-all.

9dheR9AlAe6YLvu1swBtzw.text: I had a $25 off $50 gift certificate from restaurant.com that I paid $4 for so that why I ate at Envy. Service was good. I ordered the ribeye that was expertly cooked. It had a real nice charcoal flavor to it. I was offered 3 types of salt to complement the steak but it was already well flavored. The steak was tender and I had no problems finishing it. It was a little thinner than I expected it to be for 19 oz. The truffle fries were the best fries that I have had. I love the shoe string type and they were hot and crispy. The cheese, pepper, and truffle oil made them very flavorful. I also had the creamed corn--I like the crispiness of them but I wish I could taste more of the bourbon in them. All in all a nice meal if you have the restaurant.com GC. I wouldn't pay full price here.

7MZPtjeBWsyKRBhc4I7UYg.text: This place was great a bit pricey but you could definitely share a steak. the asparagus was great and they gave different sauces for your steak. The best one though is their house sauce. Great special of the day appetizer, risotto balls. You can get a restaurant.com certificate for the place and that makes it a great deal. The service was excellent.

be34IDZu6pMqB6iEliYVgg.text: This place was fantastic!! I searched Yelp for a great steakhouse to try while I was in Vegas and based on reviews I decided on this one. Hands down best choice!! Not only was the food amazing but the service was above and beyond what I was hoping for. Our server, Alaina, could not have been better. She answered all of our questions with such knowledge and detail we were blown away. She was also very personable and just overall really great. I got the crab cake to start which was very good but could have been bigger. (Isn't that always the way..) My friend got the caesar salad which was huge and very tasty. We both ordered the black angus filet mignon and it was out of this world!! I was so full halfway through but couldn't stop eating it. The only thing I didn't like was that the outside had some of that char stuff on it, but it wasn't too bad. We also ordered the trio tasting of mashed potatoes which included garlic, bacon and Gruyere, and truffle. All three were excellent and definitely enough for 2 people to share. With that we ordered the asparagus with hollandaise sauce which was delicious. That came with enough for probably 4 people to share... I got the restaurant.com gift certificate before going. $75 off a $150 min purchase for $30. The only thing is you have to order those ones at the beginning of the month because they tend to sell out early.... I really enjoyed my visit to Envy. I am definitely going back to Vegas and I will be sure to go here again and again.

18ymFhQ3WgCnNmlyPluK6A.text: Great service.  The steak was cooked fantastically and did not need any of the sauces you have a choice of.  I'm glad they kept it on the side.  Staff was polished but friendly at the same time.  No brainer if you're staying at the hotel and worth the trip even if you aren't.

kvNUHPQFxNaVK5gkjhTHWQ.text: Visited on a weekday night, after 10:00PM.  The place was busy, but not crowded.  I had the braised pork ribs with onion rings and celery root puree, along with a side order of their mashed potatoes & truffles. The ribs were excellent, the onion rings were crispy and not greasy at all.  The mashed potatoes were of a perfect texture, in my opinion, with good helping of truffles for the price.  The place isn't very big, with somewhat of a lounge feel, but all in all it was a great dinner.

pk3PshlZSzh5rex5KWR-jw.text: Recently came back from a trip to Las Vegas and was fortunate enough to come across Envy Steakhouse.  We started off with the Black Pepper Calamari and Rock Shrimp.  It was one of if not the best Calamari I ever had, extremely tender, not oil, just delicious.  A must have!  The wife had an arugula salad.  She said it was one of the best salads she has ever had.  We both had steak that was cooked perfectly and was wonderful.  On top of this the staff that served us was the nicest, most helpful staff I have ever came across in my entire life, and that is no exaggeration.  Our server Todd was extremely knowledgeable, kind, helpful, and a great conversation.  Hes the main reason I felt it necessary to write this review.  I fully recommend this restaurant.

OIf_4YmucSgjTdqMhCTIaw.text: The flatbread pizzas were very excellent.  I got breakfast from this restaurant for room service a few times, and they were good.  The steaks were so-so, but the eggs were cooked well and the bagels were decent considering they weren't fresh baked (like from a bagel joint).

SEW1uanoqR3UqXRkIQbAZQ.text: didn't like their lunch menu.  shouldn't gotten the ceaser salad, was the worst I've had.

5ihNXdJmB-A_DSl053jxiA.text: The mac and cheese alone was enough reason to give envy a five ate review. However do not let the excellent selection of mac and cheese atop you from enjoying the amazing steak they serve there

2BVvj2ghtlkx0T5rPQ_Ugw.text: We were in Las Vegas for our anniversary for 5 days; 4 days at the Wynn Encore and 1 at the Renaissance Las Vegas Hotel where ENVY is located our last day. We both love steak, so we thought that ENVY would be a perfect restaurant to conclude our stay in Vegas. Unfortunately, ENVY did not live up to its ratings. Our waiter approached our table with a friendly manner, however, when I asked if they had a nice Malbec wine, he just thrust the "wine by the glass" menu towards me. Unfortunately, no Malbec, but this was no problem because they had a nice Merlot from the California central coast that I hadn't tried and was very good. The "special" for the evening  was a "20 oz porterhouse steak with seasonal vegetables".   Since my husband and I usually split a porterhouse (the filet for me, the surloin to my hubby), we ordered it. The waiter became a bit huffy when we didn't order an appeizer or salad, but a big steak and veggies would ordinarily be enough for the two of us. The waiter haughtl  manner lectured us on how the chef would not cut the steak and serve it on two plates; well, I hope not because all the wonderful juices will spill out. I asked for two plates. While the dinner was being prepared, the waiter came to our table with a bread basket; but went on and on about the special chocolate and nut bread that was included. The bread offered was not anything special except perhaps for the tinny sprig of fresh rosemary in the butter, a nice touch. The waiter returned with 3 types of salt and went on about how special they were; I'm not a big salt user, but my husband seemed to be impressed with the one that had a smoke flavor.  When our dinner arrived at our table, we were, to say the least, disappointed by the size of the steak. At most, it was maybe 14 oz; perhaps it was 20 oz before they trimmed it (it was a 28-day aged steak), but it wasn't as presented to us before we ordered. The veggies were good: not strong garlic mashed potatoes and a medley of potato, beet, and carrots, but all total about 1 cup of veggies. I did like the consistent rosemary herb flavor throughout the meal, but the portion size (although it was enough for a light meal) was not as presented before ordering.  We didn't order desert. Our waiter didn't even acknowledge us as we paid the bill and walked out although the other assistant servers were really nice as was the hostess.  I would not recommend this restaurant. It is overpriced and overly pretentious. Our bill was well over $100 for one meal and two drinks; our very nice hotel room and excellent service at the Renneisance was less than the meal. We left a 20% gratuity that hopefully went to people other than the snooty waiter. It was not the highlight of our anniversay stay in Las Vegas.

GSlTspqJSTQwoOL4v9ylqA.text: We went for the Sunday brunch.   The food was fantastic!  Made-to-order yummy omelets, fat tasty sausages, thick, crisp bacon, vanilla raisin brioche french toast (YUMMM!!),  belgian waffles made to order,huge cold crab legs and shrimp, an assortment of cheeses, fresh fruit, bagels with smoked salmon, cream cheese and capers, finger sandwiches,  and more.  Not to mention the all-you-can-drink champagne, mimosas and make-your-own bloody marys! The downsides were 1) the service was "sporadic" as another reviewer put it, and our dishes weren't cleared very often.  We ended up eating dessert amidst dirty dishes from our meal.  And 2) the food in the silver servers (potatoes, french toast, pancakes) was cold.  The sausage and bacon were under heat lamps, but were lukewarm.   And we were one of the first people seated!  I was expecting nice hot food.   However, the food was sooo yummy we will definately be going back!   The live entertainment was good, but was a little too loud to have a conversation without raising your voice.

vLOif1-ZnR_kCFX8euLsDg.text: This place was absolutly awesome. Totally worth the cab over to the marriott if you are staying on the strip. When you first walk into the restaurant you will be greeted by an enourmous wall of wine encased in a sweet glass case. I had the ribeye which was recommended by the waiter and it was to die for! Only bad thing about my experience was i thought i ordered an $80 bottle of wine but instead it ended up being $250. It was my mistake but the waiter talked tot he manager and they agreed to split the difference which was fine with me. Overall great service great food, great atmosphere.

sVrpkDjFJ5EpVwN2c3XyIQ.text: After much research I chose Envy for my husband and I to dine at on the only night we had free while I was on a business retreat. First the hostess got my husbands name wrong, no big deal, but when he corrected her she says, "Whatever, it doesn't matter"! We overlooked that as she was young and inexperienced. Our server was very knowledgeable about the menu items, but I felt a slight chill from him when we did not order cocktails or wine. We don't drink alcohol, enough said about that. We started with the tuna and crabmeat dynamite, which was delicious, but at $17 was miniscule and overpriced. There was a tiny bit of caviar on top, but not enough to justify the price. It was nicely presented. I ordered the bone-in filet mignon and my husband ordered the bone-in ribeye. Both were cooked perfectly, but I doubt the filet was 16 ounces with bone as indicated. For $49 I expected more than I got. Sad. The server, I felt, should have told us that the sides were enough for at least 2 people as we ordered the lobster mashed potatoes (good while hot but bad when not), the asparagus (so-so), the truffle french fries (tasty but enough to feed 6 people), and the creamed corn, which we both thought the best thing on the menu. Needless to say we could not finish any of the sides, in fact we hardly put a dent in them. I felt like the server was upselling by not telling us the portion size because we didn't order wine. I've been a server so I know about upselling, but at least I was honest with my customers! Our bill came to $185, with dessert, which was unremarkable. Overall, we were disappointed with our experience there. Too bad, because it is a beautiful, romantic setting. Most reviews I've read were 5 stars, but I can't justify it here.

Zde5zjlWPRbJ3_dDi2HCMg.text: As you can see from my other reviews...I don't give 5 stars.  5 stars should be saved for the best of the best, and finally, I found THE BEST !!! Thank you Envy for making the BF's birthday memorable. From making the reservation to our waiter running after us with a forgotten item, Envy goes the extra mile. The friendly hostess asked if this was a special occasion when I called to make the reservation, and since the BF was right there, I had to be coy.  The hostess immediately took the cue, and did all the talking, telling me that she would make sure we had a special table, and desert on the house.  I confirmed the reservation the following day, and was greeted by name...she recognized my voice, and remembered that I wasn't able to talk.  When I told her that it was the BF's birthday, she said that the desert would have a BD candle..nice touch. The restaurant itself is comfortable.  Steakhouse dark. Service was perfect.  Attentive, but not stiffling Our waiter was so down to earth, unlike any other in Vegas.   He actually steered me towards a wine which was cheaper, and better than it's more expensive counterpart.   The funny thing is that at lunch the next day, the waitress at Capital Grille made me feel like I was ordering Ripple when I ordered it, and of course tried to steer me towards a $23 glass vs the $13 glass...but that's a whole other story and review.   So, back to Envy. Starters was the Fois Gras.  Perfect.  Rich. Decadent. Dinner :  Bone In Rib Eye for the BF-- Huge, Perfectly Cooked Me:  Bone In Fillet --yes..bone in !!  1st time experience for me.  Made the Fillet even more yummy, since there was a bit of fat near the bone. Portions are huge there, so we didn't order a side or veggie. Oh, I can't forget the BF's BD desert.  We had several choices, but went for the NY Cheesecake. Wow !!! It was the lightest, fluffiest cheesecake I've ever had. All in all, a 5 star restaurant which was worth ever penny. A Must when in Vegas.

-38j5h1OPT_4Iu6NKEnMTg.text: Probably the best ribeye steak I have ever had.  Went there with my family to get some fine dining  and prime steak away from the overpriced hotels.  Its off the strip but pretty close by cab, and it was less of an inconvinience that we thought it would be.  Its pricey but definately worth it.  I also recommend the creamed spinach side dish.  Great service as well.   Made me wish I spent more money on steaks and less losing at craps

BoSl71D2wJTJRfgjhwIoOQ.text: Envy the Steakhouse has some of the best service I've encountered so far in Las Vegas. The waitress was very informative on the menu, made a great recommendation for a cocktail, and when they served our food they explained the dishes we ordered with detail which was unexpected but nice. We ordered the seafood platter for two, a grilled rib eye to share, grilled vegetables, and the truffle oil Parmesan fries which was served as a mountain of fries. These fries are so good and you receive a lot for your money. The manager of the restaurant even came by to our table to introduce himself and make sure we were enjoying our meal, which we thought was very nice.  They didn't know It was our anniversary but you would think that they did because the service was excellent and they really made our night special,  we had such a great time dining there, and would definitely go there again.

ePGdyfRX5s6FiQCKPhjOrA.text: Off the strip restaurant/hotel but a must! Nice upscale restaurant and service. Professional, welcoming & friendly from the moment you arrive to the end of your dining experience. Our server Stephanie was awesome, she took very good care of us. My son wanted pasta with marinara sauce...this does not exist on the menu but Stephanie made it happen. The chef whipped up a linguini pasta w/marinara sauce and a grilled chicken breast. It was perfect! All 4 adults decided on the :  Bone in ribeye (perfectly seasoned and cooked)  with the fas grois butter.  Sides (share-able size):  Lobster mac n cheese (good) Creamed spinach (good but more like sauteed spinach) Creamed corn (awesome! Made fresh off the cobb) Appetizer:  2 orders of Calamari & Shrimp (very good). The manager here (Maria) is wonderful! We will definitely be back and Envy is highly recommended by all of us =)

0EXLO2zrnfRY9KMVGr297g.text: Very elegant place for a nice dinner. Your date would be impressed. The room is a bit darker than your typical restaurant. The drink variety is good and the wine selection is ample. The food selection is also very good. I tried the chicken with mashed potatoes!! Delicious.

kGj742id1RzBU31UBJtIqg.text: Delicious Service was great, ambiance great, able to accommodate large group. I had the Sea Bass and lobster mac. Both fabulous, truly enjoyed the flourless chocolate cake very decadent. 3rd time hear, never disappointed

jg267t-ceJTIfYO2UIL2Wg.text: Pretty dead restaurant during off season time. Located beside the Convention Center so it attracts lots of business people during those times otherwise it's pretty quiet. Favorite part of our meal was the mound of Truffle Fries although it could've used more Truffle Oil. Bone in Filet Mignon, a massive portion, was cooked perfectly medium rare. Regular Filet Mignon on the other hand was overcooked and dry with no pink. Lobster Mac & Cheese felt overload with the Velveeta-ish cheese and no trace of lobster. Enjoyed the medley of sauteed mushrooms much more. Signature Sea Bass with Truffle Butter Crust, Shitake Mushrooms, and Asparagus was a very nice light meal, cooked perfectly. Sea Bass was moist, the crust was flavorful though it could've used a bit more Truffle oil as well. Overall, enjoyed the excellent service and certain aspects of our meal.

photos.caption: Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. ENVY Signature Sea Bass w/Truffle Butter Crust, Shitake Mushrooms, Asparagus.
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mound of Truffle Fries

oj5oTLelNML-TZoSRARizA.text: Location was poor  Decor was decent and upscale  Lobster Mac and Cheese was good  Bread was ok  Service was poor  Tomahawk steak was poor

15WfwxW_Ww86K_KJk0sU_g.text: I want to first thank Deontae for making my date night special with my beautiful wife. This steakhouse is very underrated for it's food and it's service. My wife and I came to Envy Steakhouse at around 7:30pm and was greeted nicely by the gentleman at the hostess table. We were seated very quickly and ordered our wine and app.. The app. was expresso rub flank steak. Cooked medium rare and very tasty. Then onto the entree and sides. My wife ordered the U10 scallop special And I ordered the sea bass. The sides were truffle fries and  steamed asparagus with bearnaise sauce. Every bite that my wife and I had of the food was very memorable. I speak with a lot of passion because I am a chef. This restaurant will be my top 50 restaurant that I have eaten the USA. Great job Envy Steakhouse!!!

photos.caption: Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea Bass
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. U10 Scallops
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wow

KAhxVUCXZ60fZJNeByrH-w.text: Went here for breakfast. I had the eggs Benedict which were quite good. Would have preferred fruit in the side instead of potatoes to balance the starch in the muffins. But it was made properly and the potatoes we'd good too!

neMAzqVk_JqCpJOXd6Yx-w.text: I wanted to like this place more as I had heard some good things about it.  We had a gift certificate we won in a silent auction at a charity event last year.  Our server told us that Envy donates to stuff like that a lot, so points for Envy.  We made our reservation for a Sunday evening, and it was not crowded. Maybe 4 tables.  We sat in a high-backed booth, which gave you more privacy and a feeling you were isolated.  This was nice.  The wine list was average for the strip in similarly priced steakhouses, maybe a little above average.  Lots of choices, but you will pay for them to be sure.  To start, the wife had the BLT wedge salad.  This may be the best salad I've ever eaten.  The blue cheese they use was of the highest quality, as was the thick bacon.  And, they load the toppings on.  The dressing had a little pepper in it as well, which really increased the flavor.  Just a fantastic salad that was flawlessly executed.  My appetizer did not go as well.  I had the shrimp cocktail, which comes with 3 sauces.  This dish didn't work for us.  The shrimp are large, which was nice, but the sauces were either too sweet or not spicy enough (the cocktail).    To eat, my wife had the filet, and I had the bone-in ribeye.  Hers was fine, a perfect rare.  Mine on the other hand had gone from getting a nice char to burned in spots.  It was mostly medium rare, but I guess they had some flare ups on the grill because it was beyond charred in places.  Made enjoying difficult.  I also found the size and quality of the steak to not be worthy of the price, which was $52.    For sides, we had the 4 cheese mac and cheese and the famous whiskey creamed corn.  Both were $10, and both were quite a large serving.  4 people easily could share these appetizers.  The mac and cheese was the better of the two in my estimation.  If the sauce was a LITTLE thicker, it would have been a home run.  But, good cheese flavor, and not greasy or heavy.  The creamed corn was good, crisp corn with bite and a nice cream sauce.  I wouldn't say it's the best I've ever had, that's probably Del Frisco's, but it was a good steakhouse creamed corn.  Service was FANTASTIC.  Knowledgeable server and our water/wine glasses were never close to empty.  Very friendly, but didn't hover.

mwjwrYCawbISY8zT3TD5eg.text: When I walked up to the host stand, there was no one around, so I walked over to check out if there was room to grab a seat at the bar. There wasn't room so I walked back over to the host stand when someone finally came over and seated me. My server did not smile and extend the same hospitality that the rest of the restaurant and hotel seem to emanate. He did have professionalism, but was missing the hospitality aspect that focuses on how you make people feel. I felt the same about the server assistant who I could barely understand.   The Caesar salad was very tasty, but the Caprese appetizer had mealy tomatoes and lacked flavor or seasoning. The Steak appetizer was grisly and just not a quality cut. The server stopped by but each time I could barely understand what he said through his clenched teeth. When I asked for the rest of my food to go his assistant boxed two separate dishes together in one huge box and left out half of the bread I had also requested to go. I am a foodie but also hate to waste food and thought I might be hungry enough to finish eating when I got back to my room. I called and let the manager know about the food being boxed together improperly because it was so unappealing! He very graciously apologised and agree that should not have happened and insisted on assigning a $25 food credit to my room. So although my experience was not the best, it was made up for with a room service breakfast the next day in its place, due to excellent management.

photos.caption: Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Table ambiance and extra large bread basket for one person.
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love the decor and a good glass of Malbec.

8qVbWC6bp2Ab93TBr2k27g.text: If this restaurant ever wanted to stand by itself on the strip, they would not have any problem bringing in business.  The waiters are very knowledgeable about the menu and all the dishes.  However, one shortfall was that their so-called sommelier suggested a wine that was much cheaper than the one we originally picked out.  Since our group was on vacation, we wanted to spend money.  Wine was only a fraction of our meal and the rest of it spoke for itself.  Many in the group ordered the filet mignon while I ordered the surf and turf.  Cooked to near perfection complimented by truffle fries and a bland mac n' cheese.  By the end of the night, we were stuffed and super happy.  Simply a great experience and will look forward to coming back next time!

photos.caption: Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surf n&#39; Turf
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EQv9MYwvdDu_6pd27U4PtQ.text: When our server "Josh" came over to our table to explain all the options on the menu he only made our dinner selection more difficult. The fire roasted shrimp sounded amazing and it was.  Presentation was exceptional and as Josh described it, "you really don't even know where to start taking the first bite".   Like most of the other steakhouses in Vegas the entrees come with a price tag but quality and service are both exceptional. Ambiance could use a few steps up but overall this place has some great options on the menu and doubt you'll be disappointed here.

S4uL45ouLTy3mgXFEG1xRg.text: Our server Carr was great! He was very attentive and checked on us at the right times during our meal. The food was good and there was a lot of it. The value was worth it using the Groupon.

KK7tz8Tx2Ck3D2vlHpBsBQ.text: This is my 100th review and I am glad I can use it for a place that deserves this recognition and honor. :-) I've eaten here twice by now and both times we used the $100 restaurant.com coupon. In fact, that's how we found the place. We wanted to find a new place and looked at restaurant.com for restaurants for our Vegas trip. This place had great reviews, so we picked it. Our experience was so wonderful the first time last year that we went back this year again. I just can't say enough good things about this restaurant. The decor, the lighting, in other words, your first impression is already up for a good start. Everything is beautiful, warm and subtle, including the menus. Their wine list is simply amazing! They have all varietals you'd like for every budget. Josh is very knowledgeable about wine and has great recommendations. He even let us taste a couple selections by the glass as we were hesitant what to get. He gets good reviews here and I can vouch for that. He's very professional, yet friendly and funny, amazingly helpful and simply charming. The first time, after we decided what we wanted to eat, I noticed that at the bottom of the menu they were offering a 3-course tasting menu for a discounted price and it had exactly what we wanted. I can't remember what exactly they were, but I know I had the sae bass and my roommate had the steak and everything was just wonderful. This time last month, we had the oven roasted, stuffed tomato. My roommate doesn't like tomatoes, but I ordered it for myself and we still shared it and he loved it. In fact, after dinner he said that the stuffed tomato was probably the best dish that night. Since I don't eat red meat, I ordered the sea bass again, but it never disappoints. It's always perfect, tenderly juicy yet flaky, just wonderful. The shiitake mushroom and asparagus garnish is also very flavorfully prepared. I had the New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc with my fish. My roommate had the 10 oz. Filet Mignon and he loved it. They 3 different salts they give you are all amazing. I just used it on my bread. But one of them (can't remember which) really goes well with the steak. He had a Syrah that he just loved. You would think that the portions are not that great, but with a 3-course meal, you really get stuffed. We ordered 2 desserts and they were also just mouthwateringly wonderful. I wish I could have ordered one of each of the desserts, but I couldn't have eaten them all, but any desserts we had there was both time amazing. I can't remember the names of the two ladies who helped Josh out, but they were also delightful. As I said earlier, I can't praise this place enough. Both times, everything was top notch. The food, the wine, the service, everything. I can't understand why this place is not more crowded (we actually like this fact). :-) Anyway, do yourself a favor. When you're in Vegas, try Envy. You will not regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan seared Sea Bass with portobello mushroom abd asparagus.
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just a plain old Wedge Salad the &#34;Envy&#34; way.

rWEn3hm9exGJBmKOABPULA.text: *** Warmly lit, big cushioned chairs. ***  Bread ... very moist, fresh ... 4 Fried Calamari ... light, tasty ... 4 Truffle fries ... a must try dish ... 5 Asparagus ...... thin yet flavorful ... 3 Creamy corn ... bourbony, bacony ... 5 Petite Filet Mignon ... melts in mouth ... 5  *** I will definitely return.  About $100/pp. ***

O68si-W1C0J9VL5aLzn2nQ.text: We-Groupon it, and it was a Nice Dinner. Bone-in Filet 12oz. & 8oz. Reg. Filet were Good, but not the best ever. Cooked Steak Temps. met our Radar. We, Ordered the Shrimp Cocktail and it Looks great the way it's served, but you get 3 Shrimp-So, as a couple you either fight over the 3rd. One or Split it-Come on make it 4 shrimp @ $16 bucks for 3 it was not worth it-Plus they WAY over cooked the Shrimp. The Lobster Mac @ $8 Bucks was pretty Good..My favorite was the added 6oz. Lobster Tail..The Best Tail I've ever had in 45 year's of eating on this Planet. Witch was odd since they Messed the Shrimp Up. I usually do not do Lobster because it usually sucks everywhere. Server was New but, did a Good job..Would return..

photos.caption: Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp cocktail  $16
Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet and 6oz. Lobster

g6sITDL9JdYfnpaObs9iTg.text: Fancy, pricey, more hardware and glassware than one can count. Extremely attentive and polite staff. The heirloom tomato appetizer was a hard green tomato and a flavorless  extra firm red tomato. it they are heirloom the were from the mattell family. The Caesar salad was nice, small but nice. The Shrimp cocktail had three colossal shrimp, extra firm. I me it was a tough cut. I guess I was not impressed, and three stars is generous, very generous. Each dish was photo perfect and for some that would be impressive. I think I did not have enough (read none) to drink as a precursor to dinner.  I guess I will just move along. Sorry ENVY.

ftPJwyctjYo9amwtKoIaJg.text: I was really disappointed.   This was my Birthday dinner.   We used the Living Social Coupon. Went here because a friend had suggested it.  To each his own, I guess.    We had..  Caprese Salad. - Very bland tomatoes, in fact one was mushy and a bad texture.  There was No salt on the table, which killed this dish completely.  Shrimp Cocktail - Shrimp were pretty tasteless, and although they had some sauces, there was no where near enough sauce for the amount of shrimp  Tomato Soup - Was good, but acidic, it needed a cream to break the acidity.  Bone-in Rib Eye - Way too fatty and tough.    Garlic Mashed - Good, esp with the Veal DemiGlace  Lobster Mac and Cheese - Good, very fishy flavor, if you like that.  it was  ok to me.  I have had This in other restaurants where it was not "lobster" enough.   This was not the case here.  The experience:  First, a different waiter than ours was retrieving plates near our table and dropped a plate on the floor, right next to us, glass shattered everywhere.  Hitting mine and my wife's bare feet and legs (We had Sandals on) The waiter didn't ask if we were ok, didn't apologize, he just acted as if nothing happened.  I was also worried that shards of glass maybe made it on our appetizer plates, because it was that explosive, but they did NOTHING about it.  My wife and I BOTH visibly checked our feet and legs and I had a knick on my leg from glass, the waiter saw us visually inspecting our feet and still said nothing.         Next, when I ordered the steak, Bone-in Rib eye,  I asked for Red Wine Reduction sauce and Herb Butter.  - When my steak was delivered, they forgot the Red Wine Reduction completely, and gave me what looked like Herb Butter, but chunkier.  Without testing it, I dolloped it on my steak and began spreading it, and noticed obvious Bleu Cheese chunks.  I tasted it and it was for SURE Blue Cheese, within the butter.   I did not order this of course, but I know Bleu Cheese for sure.   The waiter came back and I told him of the mistake, and he apologized, but also said they don't even have a Bleu cheese Butter, so he doesn't know how this happened.   He was good about it, but I did feel like they were calling me a bit of a lier as they mentioned a few times that they dont have Bleu cheese butter, and dont know that happened.   I cook... I know Blue cheese, AND, others on my table got the herb butter and it was completely different.     They did bring me a a new steak, BUT at that point I was eating after the rest of my party, and it was awkward.  To top it off, I was   Up to that point the best thing was the Red Wine Reduction, when they did bring it with my new steak.   Which is sad  They did bring a chocolate cake for my birthday and that was the star of the night for sure.     Too bad the actual food was no good.  The waiter was good and attentive, so I will give him kuddos for that.

Hx3cW_RhNk_lSzmWru-bvw.text: A nice solid steakhouse with good quality food, nice atmosphere and good service. I was not blown away by the selection as the menu is quite limited (no steak tar tar, no oysters, no foie gras). Wine list and cocktail list is good. Stared with caesar salad and it was excellent, nothing I haven't had before but I really liked the way they prepare it here. The bread basket was nothing unusual, four pieces of white bread biscuits with a side of butter. Yawn. Nothing on the appetizer list made me want to order one, as the selection was a little boring (truffle fries, shrimp cocktail, sauteed mushrooms and french onion soup...seen it all before).   I choose the lamb which was perfect (two nice size shanks) and my gust has the mignon which was slightly dry, but still good enough. We chose to share a side of creamed corn with bourbon. It had a slight egg nog flavor which was surprising and I was on the fence at first, but I ended up enjoying it.   Also, the dessert selection was unimaginative. I had a chocolate lava cake with ice cream and a rice crispy ball on top. The cake was dry and Im sorry but I can get a rice crispy treat at Starbucks.  My guest had the carrot cake which was soft and delicious.  Overall a little too expensive and nothing out of the ordinary, but for a nice evening out you can do worse.

Jxc_jgYV_saxCtfAt-LnZQ.text: This review is only for the breakfast. We never had a chance to have dinner. Our group stayed at the Renaissance due to a expo at the convention center next door. We decided to have breakfast at Envy Sunday morning. BIG mistake, I know that Sunday was the start of the show but this was ridiculous. Here's a mental note, DO NOT GET THE EGGS at the breakfast buffet. They are runny and taste awful. The breakfast buffet was decent. Fresh fruit, bacon, sausage, eggs, muffins, bagels, and toast, yogurt, oatmeal (lumpy and awful), and pancakes. Looked a little more than a continental breakfast and expensive, thank God my boss had vouchers. The food wasn't the worst part of it, it was the service. Granted there are 8 of us but if you're going to provide crappy service don't charge us the tip. 3 breakfasts that were made to order from the menu came out to 75 bucks! The breakfasts took a long time to get to the table. We had to track down the waitress to get water or refills. She wasn't that friendly to begin with like she didn't want to be there in the first place and you could hardly understand her accent. Needless to say after that we had breakfast at the convention center or upstairs on the 15th floor were they had a continental breakfast. I don't know if I'll be coming back or if our group will. Maybe their more organized for dinner but at this point why try. BTW, the restaurant is hidden. It looks like it's just a bar area but if you walk around the curve you'll head right into the restaurant.

3Q41Wl63W1VRy4VwBiNK-g.text: I love this place. The food and service are consistently great. Especially the Chilean sea bass.

IRK8Sg5StdDs1W3xJWOfJQ.text: What a wonderful surprise to find such an amazing restaurant in a hotel. ENVY is five stars all the way. The service was perfect, the special Bloody Marys were beyond delicious and the food was out of this world.  The Chilean Sea Bass was as good as the waiter promised. As were the lamb chops. Also had the creamed corn as a side (it could've passed for dessert.) I really hope to be back as soon as my travel schedule permits.

jRaxz_3OfpeKnVkiq56sKQ.text: Three course meal w/ drinks for a very reasonable price purchased from groupon. Delish and generous with portions. Every dish is amazing, except the mushroom. Its a bit salty for my taste, but other than that, it was great. The place  is quite romantic and if you reserve a head of time, you will be seated right away.   Friendly staff: very professional, attentive and great service.  Fyi - You can self-park with a fee of $7.00 for 3 hours.

qCpClZUi7yG5BpDl9VxkGw.text: I don't think many restaurants are envious of this steakhouse's predicament. Vegas tourists worship new, shiny establishments; floundering businesses, like Envy the Steakhouse located in the Renaissance Hotel, end up offering discounts via deal sites to drum up interest. After our event at  nearby Las Vegas Convention Center, we walked into an empty Envy with a Groupon we had purchased just hours ago, the upside of which was attentive service.   We shared an heirloom tomato salad, served with, interestingly enough, yellow peach tomatoes, & a french onion soup which he called "generic," meaning it could've come from any chain restaurant.   I'd give their sides alone 4 stars. The mountain of truffle fries were hard to stop eating & there were sections of shucked corn in the bourbon creamed corn.  He was pleased with his porterhouse, my filet was so dry, neither the peppercorn nor the horseradish sauce could salvage it.   Part of our deal was a dessert each. You'd think that would earn them an extra star in my book, but the cheesecake with berries & chocolate torte were both very middle-of-the road.   With so many choices in Sin City, I'd have a hard time choosing Envy again. (Next time I'm picking Lust or Gluttony.) ;-)

NZCkSZrcBNNQEhpnOGt_DA.text: My wife and I are new to  the Las Vegas area. We have not yet developed our local "Go To" list of restaurants. It was also our 10th wedding anniversary. When the group-on came available (2 appetizers/2 drinks/1 side/2 entrees/2 desserts) I decided to check out Envy. It had fairly good reviews and we hadn't found "THE" restaurant yet, so we decided to give it a try.  We arrived at the hotel and used the valet ($10.00) for our vehicle. The valet was friendly and escorted us into the hotel to show us the restaurant. It had a classic/modern appearance and was about 70% full - on a Tuesday evening (7pm).  We were quickly seated at a table and introduced to out waiter for the evening. He quickly explained the group-on offer and the menu. Our order was quickly taken and drinks delivered.  We ordered two Lobster Bisques/Garlic Broccolini/Shrimp entree/Scallop entree/Cheesecake/Brownie cake w/ice cream.  The Lobster Bisque was made from a good tomato base and plenty pieces of lobster. Very tasty and enjoyable.  My wife had the Shrimp Entree. It was lightly toasted and moist. She enjoyed it immensely.  I had the scallops wrapped in bacon. It was flavorful and moist.  The Garlic Broccolini was almost inedible. The garlic was so strong that it emptied your sinus and burned your throat.  The desserts were okay.  The service was great, and the meals were enjoyable. The question was the value for your money? Was the atmosphere worth the elevated prices? No! Was the restaurant conducive for an intimate or personal dinner? No! (it was quite noisy the entire night that caused you to elevate your voice in order to be heard). Was the portions commensurate with the cost of the meal? No! ($38.00 for 4 scallops? Same for the shrimp).  We enjoyed the service and the food was good but not really worth the time/money. For our 10th anniversary, the only thing memorable was the company.

S3aRPQGiMggeE56aM1Kw0A.text: Good service, but the food was poor. Chilean sea bass was extremely oily and basically inedible. The Cesar salad was served with bacon, hard boiled egg, peppers and capers!? And wilted (formerly frozen) lettuce. I probably should have just ordered an overpriced steak.

ISAgXuc8ZBgd28N7TK6eyg.text: This was one of the best dining experiences my wife and I have ever had. Came here for anniversary dinner. We had the crab cakes and shrimp cocktails for appetizers. My wife had the filet mignon and I had the garlic herb crusted Australian lamb chops. For dessert we had chocolate torte and cheesecake. Every single item was incredible and our server Stephanie made the night perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of ENVY The Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1eA8-VOXqQ4h3ZBcJAEiCA.text: This place is a HIDDEN GEM!!! I came here on a Groupon and was EXTREMELY impressed by the food and service. ENVY is located inside of the Renaissance hotel which made me a little nervous because not all restaurants in chain hotels are created equal, but this one EXCEEDED my expectations.   Upon arrival we were promptly seated for our reservation in a tall booth that blocked the conversations of our neighbors. Our waiter Jacey (or J.C?) came over and explained the Groupon special to us which was extremely helpful. I started out with a perfectly made cosmo, calamari & shrimp, and the crab cakes. It was then that I realized that their SAUCES were top notch! The sauces served with the calamari were unique and delicious, and the chipotle aioli served with the crab cakes had the perfect flavor and hint of spice that paired well with the mango salsa!  For my entree I had an 8oz Filet and added Bearnaise sauce. My steak was cooked to a perfect medium and the Bearnaise was DELICIOUS! I also tasted the porterhouse which was extra juicy, and the peppercorn sauce which was even better than my Bearnaise!!!! Also the MOUNTAIN of TRUFFLE FRIES.... let's just say I hate half of them before even touching my steak!  For dessert we had the flourless chocolate cake and cheesecake with berries. The chocolate cake was extra sweet and chocolaty and tasted more like a mousse, but was still good if you like sweet, chocolate desserts. The cheesecake was rich and creamy, and the berries tasted fresh.  This experience was perfect from our awesome waiter, to the food, to the drinks, and the SAUCES!!! This restaurant will be on my list of places to visit in Vegas from now on!!!

26jxWVG5G89QXrGkJ74_SA.text: This restaurant will be on my list every time we visit Vegas!!! It was easy to call and make a reservation. The service was spectacular. Tahtiana (spelling of her name may be wrong) was very friendly, knowledgeable and attentive.   My husband ordered the shrimp cocktail, we live in Florida and these 3 shrimp were huge!  I had the crab cakes appetizer and they were very good.   I ordered a "sex on the beach" cocktail which was made correctly, and my husband ordered a beer which was cold.   Our steaks were fabulous! We also got the plate of fries to share. We could have shared the fries with 3 other people.   I don't know how we were able to eat dessert!!! We ordered the cheesecake. I felt like the cheesecake had been frozen prior to us ordering it because it was still kinda frozen.

cCVOfpborru3cDEx5Te0TA.text: I've been here twice, once in July & in December 2018. Both times this place was mostly empty.   The first time we had reservations and hit traffic due to an accident on the freeway and would be at least 30 minutes late. I called 5 times and nobody picked up the phone at the hostess stand. When we got there, despite the restaurant being nearly empty, nobody was at the hostess stand and employees nearby were running around saying they'd be with us shortly. Actually, it was the same way the second visit as well. Where is everyone running to in an empty restaurant?  First time we went, we were asked if we were celebrating anything both at the time of reservations and when we got to the restaurant. We were, a birthday. I don't know why they ask because they didn't do  anything extra during the meal. Weird.  Complimentary bread options are awful. First time we went it was boring, low quality cold assorted rolls. Second time it was slices of raisin bread.   Starters: Lobster bisque and "Vegas Caesar salad' which is basically a cob with Caesar dressing with capers and anchovy filets. Both are adequate. Lobster bisque tastes exactly like the lobster bisque at Brio.   Main: porterhouse steaks are adequate but lacking flavor. The brown sauce it automatically comes with on the side is straight up gross. It tastes sweet and oily. I had to request salt and pepper because the steak has no seasoning at all.   Sides: Lobster macaroni and cheese, and spinach. Mac and cheese tastes exactly like the lobster bisque but with noodles, which is not a complaint. No visible pieces of lobster, so I'm guessing it's lobster stock or something. Spinach is fine.   Dessert: cheesecake. Tastes like commerical cheesecake.   In general, the food is okay but forgettable. There is no wow factor and Vegas has a ton of steakhouses at a similar price point so competition is high. I have a feeling that they're not going to be in business much longer based off of how empty it was both times.

jmZP8P-3h6wIwPN9-l1NLw.text: My wife thought we would enjoy dinner at ENVY so she purchased the dinner for two with drinks Groupon for $115. We weren't disappointed as this discount is an excellent value and we definitely got our money's worth. My steak exceeded my expectations and our server gave us top notch service without any prejudices you might see with other establishments that know you are using a coupon.  Parking was free for us at the Renaissance as the gate was open and the walk was short from the deck. We were seated immediately in a secluded booth when we arrived. The restaurant was quiet and not an overbooked madhouse where you can't hear yourself think or see your server only once or twice during the meal. Speaking of our server, Josh, with 11 years of experience, took great care of us, checking on us regularly. He guided us through the menu and offered great recommendations, even giving us a sampling of wine that we were on the fence about. He was great to talk to informing us about other specials the restaurant was offering in the future.  The options for appetizers, sides, and dessert were standard for a steakhouse but executed well. The 28 day dry aged beef for my bone-in ribeye was cooked to perfection, tender, and full of juicy flavor. There are other seafood and a pasta options on the menu if you didn't want to go the beef route. Little things like a sticky menu and fingerprints on the wine glass were turn offs. But we'll keep this steakhouse as an option as long we have a Groupon so we don't have to bust open the piggy bank like we would on the Strip.

mDtCr7GBsVF83zHdcvoIFA.text: Decided to check this place out after seeing it on Groupon, because I love steak and am always looking out for new places! Service could have been a little faster, especially since there were hardly any other diners around. However, the servers were very nice and explained everything that came with the Groupon voucher upfront.  We ended up getting two 18 oz ribeyes, sauteed spinach, roasted baby beet salad, and cheesecake. Everything was pretty tasty and the steak was cooked perfectly. I would definitely consider coming back, as well as recommend this place, especially if they're still running the Groupon deal!

VH_8YxnZzGpuWj1w5oAzRw.text: Had been eyeing the Groupon deal for a while for this restaurant. And after reading reviews, decided to take the plunge for anniversary dinner. $115 for 2 appetizers, 2 drinks, 1 side to share, 2 entrees up to $52 each and 2 desserts.   Was not disappointed. Hotel was easy to access of Paradise Rd across from the Wynn. Parking was $7 for up to 4 hours for self parking, not bad at all. Parking garage is dim and not well lit, at least on the 3rd floor.   Was seated right away and the hostess took our Groupon voucher info before she sat us and asked if we were celebrating anything special. The restaurant was kind of empty with maybe about 5-6 tables/booths occupied.   Our server Joshua came out promptly and explained what we could order from the menu which was pretty much everything.   We had the crab cakes and shrimp cocktail for starters. Asparagus as the side order and the crab stuffed lobster tails. Everything was delicious in my opinion. Service was great. I would definitely return.

YggX9BtqHpNkUEduQ5wOhA.text: I found this place on Groupon and I would say  that it's one of the best service I've ever had. Easy to make a reservation and the food quality is 10/10. We also got a complimentary tomato soup and asparagus, and I would say that it's the best tomato soup and asparagus I've ever had. We ordered crab cake, calamari, shrimp, parmesan fries, and steak. They're all amazing. I would totally come back. Also, the hotel and restaurant has a great smell and ambience. In addition, there's a $7 parking fee but with the food and service they provide, it's worth it.

AJjAWkhd6_WH0zO7dYKgWg.text: Last night here was a dream! From the moment that we walked in, we were treated with phenomenal service, especially with our server Stephanie who went above and beyond to make sure our night was one to remember. This was the perfect setting for an intimate anniversary dinner.   The complimentary bread was particularly delicious, and it came with three different types of bread- olive, asiago cheese, and sourdough. They were served warm with soft butter, which speaks a lot to the quality of the restaurant. For appetizers, we ordered the calamari and the shrimp cocktail. I'm not usually a fan of calamari, but the one at Envy was mouth-watering. The calamari portion size was very generous, had the perfect crispness and were very well seasoned. They also came with two dipping sauces, tomato and an avocado crema. The shrimp cocktail were equally as impressive and came with three super size shrimps.    Let me tell you- the Truffle Parmesan Fries here are life. They come in a literal mountain of fries, and there more than enough to go around. They are super crispy or double-fried on the outside and soft on the inside and it comes with a yummy truffle aioli. Be careful- these are pretty addictive.   They generously gave us free asparagus to go with our mains for our anniversary. Our main courses were the Rack of Lamb and the Ribeye Steak with peppercorn sauce. Lamb is my absolute favorite, and it is so delicious here. Ours came with two racks of lamb, generously covered in a seasoned herb crust with a rich and flavorful side dipping sauce. The Ribeye Steak we ordered was super moist and delicious. I'm not sure if it's the best steak in town, but it sure was up there.   For the desserts, we got the chocolate cake and the cheesecake. I wasn't a huge fan of the chocolate cake since it was too sweet for my liking, but the cheesecake was on point. The cheesecake itself was super creamy, rich and melt-in-your-mouth. It was the perfect was to end a perfect meal.

bUl2SNqWycocSxZwd7ROlA.text: We went on a Groupon and it was a good deal.. the staff were super welcoming and friendly. Loved the ambience and the entire experience was really great. We had a special appetizer made by the chef for that day which was really great. The lobster bisque was good but a little too salty. The porterhouse steak was fantastic, as was the lobster tail. (I didn't love the crab stuffing on top, so they gave me an option of something else. I chose the side of spinach which was delicious! My bf loved the roasted mushrooms, but again they were too salty for me. We finished with dessert -- the chocolate cake was amazing... rich but not too sweet. And the cheesecake!! Amazing!! Soooo tasty. :-) Special shoutout to our waitress Stephanie, who was friendly, efficient, professional and excellent all the way around. We will definitely be back! Knocked off one star just for the excess salt in a couple of items.

XWqQr-KiFBd6cIBfwqznkQ.text: FANTASTIC!!!  My husband and I had an incredible dinner at ENVY The Steakhouse last week.  Everything we ordered was perfected prepared and absolutely delicious.  Hats off to the chef, Carlos.  Stephanie was our server, and she was the best server we've ever had!  We were celebrating my birthday, so she even gave us glasses of champagne at the end of our meal.  We had a perfect evening.

dI490IFRanw909BI2p2xNA.text: Came to the restaurant due to the Groupon special two dinners for $96. Included was an appetizer for each person, an entree for each person, one side to be shared and a desert for each.   We had to park in the parking structure next to the hotel. Other guests have mentioned it, it's not well lit and we had to park on the 3rd floor since it looks like the first and second floors are designated for valet. General parking at the end of the night was $7.   When we entered, the hotel was rather empty but considering we went on a Tuesday night it was to be expected. We where greeted by the hostess and it went all great from there. She was very patient when asked questions including those pertaining to Groupon. She even helped me with pulling up the voucher which she needed the number for.   After being seated in one of the booths, We where greeted by our waiter Joshua. He was very friendly and attentive. My wife started off with the onion soup and I with the crab cakes. The crab cakes where amazing in which. I was later told they used three different types of crab meat. Then we proceeded with our entree which we both got he rib-eye....that did not disappoint! For a side, we got the buttery whipped mashed potatoes which where amazing as well. Lastly, we each got a cheese cake and chocolate cake w/vanilla ice cream. Still no disappointments.  Definitely recommend this place if your looking for a small, cozy steakhouse restaurant, this is your spot!

lnfOB9acceAFgDsrvRxR-w.text: The only reason I'm giving this review at all is because of the excellent service that my waiter gave my family and I. We did not have to wait for anything with our waiter he was excellent. Didn't get his name as i was spending time with my family,  but he really set the bar for service this night. Though my family was  unimpressed with the food,  they were delighted with his service. Tall man,  tan, with colored eyes. We had dinner here around 9 pm on Tuesday. His service was 5 Star plus,  but because of the food i rated the restaurant a 2 star.   My lamb was recommended and I thought it to be delicious. However,  my aunt ordered a steak that was too charred and honestly small compared to what we've had in the last week at better steakhouses. My aunt did like the steak sauce but that's besides the point. My uncle was disgusted with his portion size of the salmon ( it looked like a 4th of the portion of the normal servings served here judging by Yelp pictures ), and the fish was way overcooked. Very tuff on a good size of each end. His lobster bisque was basic and tasted more like tomato soup, with barely any flavor of lobster.   Mind you,  our waiter aimed too please and offered several times to replace the dish with something else or comp the soup and the fish,  but my aunt and uncle wouldn't hear of it.  So we just broke up with Envy.

1M88wbdeEM1kBIIqbFoAoA.text: For awhile now I have been putting off trying Envy , so while I staying here at the hotel I have no reason not to try their amazing food. I decided to come down tonight and have drinks. I sat at the bar and the moment that one walks through the door the beauty of the restaurant surrounds you. The darker warm colors that they decided to decorate with really bring life to Envy. The hostess pointed that there was no waiting at the bar and she greeted me and made eye contact as I was approaching her. This is highly professional and and helpful to let me know we acknowledge one another mutually. The bartender handed me a drinks menu without me even having to ask. The uniforms that the staff where here are so upscale and they are more formally dressed than me.  I went with a comfort drink for me a vodka tonic. They only use top shelf alcohol here to make their mixed drinks and you can taste the difference. The bartender was very pleasant and asked if I would be dining tonight. I informed him I was just having drinks. He had a nice smile and demeanor about him. The service was fantastic. I did not stay long tonight at Envy since tomorrow is going to be a busy day for us at the last day of Pony Con!

3w88vTWVz3TGUsMB1nZs6w.text: OMG, this place is absolutely delicious! And the service was even better! I showed up with no reservation, two children and of course my son order steak tacos which is not on the menu but Anastasia, our waitress, made it happen. It's a little off the strip but SO WORTH IT!

3eE57FalgO1pfkzTxVtdmg.text: EXCELLENT AS USUAL.... I just LOVE this place. We try and visit Envy everytime we are in Vegas which is about four times/year. It never diappoints! We had a restaurant.com certificate which makes this place a steal! We had the bone-in ribeyes and the truffle fries! The steak was complimented perfectly with the assorted flavored salts. The truffle fries are absolute perfection!!!!! I'm not sure anything can top them! Our waiter, Joey, was attentive and friendly! While this restaurant is off the strip, it is fabulous and you really should try it. I haven't had anything better in Vegas....EVER! You can show up in casual dress or dressed up. We headed over to Envy after spending the day at the Hilton watching football for six hours. It is a low-key environment which is quiet, relaxing and low-key and much needed after hours of sensory overload in Vegas!

t68by0kXQuTljQAz06Ic4A.text: My wife and I visited the Envy Steakhouse on Saturday, April 14, 2012 and it was an amazing experience!  We had visited one other time a couple of years ago and we thought the service and food was great and that is why we decided to go back again this time.  This time, however, was very special. My wife and I were celebrating our 5 year anniversary on this night and everything was perfect. Joshua our waiter was very attentive and informative. He explained everything from their wine selection to the Chef's special and even the 3 three types of salt they had and what to use them on.  After dinner we engaged in small talk with Joshua were he discovered the purpose of our visit.  Joshua left and a few minutes later came back with desert for us compliments of Chef Michael.  They wrote on the plate Happy Anniversary with dark melted chocolate. A few minutes later Chef Michael came out to our table to meet us and chat. Later the manager came by to make sure our dining experience had been a good one. Joshua made our night very special, the food was amazing and we really appreciate that Chef Michael took the time to come out and personally wish us a happy anniversary!  We will definitely visit the Envy Steakhouse each time we visit Vegas!

LNJPQvkzLrOl7bes3wdtBQ.text: The golden nugget buffet uses the phrase "the perfect balance of cheap and good."  Envy should use the phrase "the perfect balance of expensive and crappy."

ZH2tv1DkV45r8DLygBe1hQ.text: Was in town for a few days and did some research. Read some great reviews on this place and also saw the added bonus of using a restaurant.com gc so decided to try it out. Not sure if we got the "coupon special" or what but the food was forgettable. We had the $75 gift cert but with tax and tip it still ended up coming to about 120 and I gotta say, I would have been much more satisfied just going to a buffet. My bf and I started with the seafood tower which was pretty decent. He ordered the bone in rib eye and I got the tasting plate. Both our steaks were flavorless and I'm not sure if they do that on purpose because they also serve an exotic salt tasting tray to put on the entrees (is it diy entree seasoning??). My pork was so dry I wanted to spit it out. The fish was okay. The parmesan fries were alright but I was expecting somethign orgasmic based on reviews from others. The creamed corn was great (and just about the only thing I enjoyed). We also ordered the Smore dessert which also lacked flavor..the brownie just tasted like a crumbly mess.. All in all, DEFINITELY WOULD NOT GO BACK. It was a major waste of money IMO. Looking back, even our cab driver was like "this is the first time anyone's ever asked to be taken here for a steak dinner..i'd go to Morton's instead." Shoulda taken that as a sign. The restaurant was also EMPTY at around 7PM on a Friday night. You wouldn't find that at a restaurant on the strip with a comparable priced menu.

JPY_bVG3xsO8GtJkEZP68w.text: If there is one bad thing to say about this place, I don't know what it is. My wife an I went there while in Vegas for my birthday. We had a coupon from Restaurant.com and didn't even think about Mother's Day being a holiday. They accepted the coupon no problem- first kudo. The service was outstanding with our server being neither intrusive nor absent and always being right there when we wanted something- second kudo. We had 4 different cocktails between us, all of them very tasty. The spicy seared Ahi appetizer was amazing. The tequila-lime shrimp were huge, delicious and came with an excellent risotto. The bone in ribeye was cooked to perfection (MR as requested) and very flavorful and I had it Oscar style (sauteed crab meat and asparagus on top minus the hollandaise sauce for me) and the crab was the best I have ever tasted. The garlic mashed potatoes that came with the entrees were awesome, and the roasted veggies were also very good.We had a caesar salad- romaine was very crisp and the dressing was tasty. For dessert we had cheesecake with berry compote (strawberries, rasberries and bluberries were all fresh) which was so good we ordered a piece to go and the molten lava cake which was just good, nothing special. My wife had an after dinner coffee which she enjoyed as well.So, Taste- third kudo. Quality of food- fourth kudo. Quantity of food- fifth kudo. Excellent food is going to be pricey. In Vegas it's even more pricey. But as hard as we tried, we still only brought the bill up to $199 (try doing that at Ruth's Chris or any other quality steakhouse in LV). Our coupon was $100 off with a purchase of $200 and while we didn't quite get there, the manager gave us our full discount without even a question. We will definitely be back- even without a coupon!

uN7oW5I7orii_gWu4kMHyg.text: My husband and I took my mother in law out for her 60th B day this weekend to ENVY. This was our second time @ ENVY the first was our 2 yr anniversary and I was pretty impressed overall with the experience and food. BUT this time uuuuh I dunno what happened. Joshua was a great server thanks Josh! My husband and mom ordered the sea-bass they both said it was great. We also had mashed potatoes & the D~lish mac n cheese. I ordered the Filet Mignon (did I spell that right :) it was tasteless  and I was completely not impressed also I added the crab legs Mmmm good. Wellllll..... the bad part sorry ladies & gents but its about to get nasty......we all got the "shits" all three of us soooo it had to be either the D~lish mac n cheese or the potatoes either way NOT GOOD.

h5tpbs0W4EVeFZ4F51icNA.text: Unbelievably good food.  Steaks were above average (not the best I have ever had, but pretty good).  The rest of the food was fantastic -- even the bread basket was WAY above awesome.  I would DEFINITELY recommend the Truffle Mac & Cheese --- I can't even describe how good it was.  The place is pricey, but for a great steakhouse it is a bargain to treat yourself here once in a while.  I will definitely be going back.  I was especially pleased with how receptive the staff was to allow my wife and I to bring our 3 month old -- its a pretty nice place, the kind of place I wasn't sure a baby would fit in (but we were in town for business and didn't have a babysitter).....the staff was welcoming and made sure we had an extra large booth for the baby carrier.  However, I would try not to bring kids to this place -- just not the right ambiance.

cGvVbr1WPRBssp99DIsyjA.text: Couldnt have been better from service to quality of the food. Had crab cakes , Caesar salad and bone in rib eye. Best crab cakes, and Caesar I have ever had   The steak was very good just the cut was a little thin which makes it hard to get very rare and charred but very good. I have been to Delmonicos ,cut,Vic and Anthony's del frisco ,micheals at south point Morton's, nine, and others in Vegas this is one of the best by far

m_0HUYgM3zUFDaB9hSugmg.text: Service is ok-good. Exceptional being French Laundry or Joel Robuchon. The server Dawn is way cool.  Appetizers average, Salad Average nothing great here just ok..  Main Course the bone in Rib eye ABSOLUTELY exceptional. One the best steaks I have ever enjoyed and I have tried every cut and every grade. The steak was also cooked to perfection the only temperature I eat is Black and Blue and this was perfect. The thing about steak houses what makes them good is the side dishes and the sides + apps + salads all mediocre. Dessert also just ok I had lemon custard. The steak was exceptional that's why it gets an extra star. Next ill go somewhere else for salads and apps and come there for main course. Best steakhouse in my mind is stil Charlie Palmers @ 4 Seasons because their apps and salads are so much better. Lets face it anyone can cook a prime piece of beef and as long as its not overcooked its going to be great! As i mentioned Black and Blue preperation at envy probably the best ive had.

IOiEtgiNobp6uQ9yL57zCQ.text: Excellent! Todd our waiter was awesome, and spot on with the wine and side dish recommendations (the Creamed Corn was the best corn dish I and my wife have ever had)! Cannot say enough about this place, a great find thanks to everyone on Yelp! We will be back again!

qRvJyGnPRQKiR6e6MZyiow.text: While attending a conference, my buddy and I had the wine dinner, ""Epicurean Adventures of the Past".  A great value, $87 for four-course dinner and four pairing wines.   The menu is:  Chilled Thai Pepper Soup  Red Curry, Thai Basil and Lemongrass Yogurt  ~From August 2006: Summer Rieslings~  Gunderloch 'Nackenheim Rothenberg' Sptlese, Rheinhessen 2005   *****  Seared Diver Sea Scallops with Smoked Trout Caviar  Mashed Potatoes and Shellfish Broth  ~From March 2007 Epicurean Adventure for Charity~  Reynold's Family Chardonnay, Napa Valley 2004   *****  Filet Stuffed with Lobster  Sauted Spinach and Truffle Sauce  ~From December 2007 Epicurean Adventure: Festival of Bubbles~  Stanley Lambert "Silent Partner", Barossa Valley 2004   *****  Lemon Curd Mousse  Fresh Raspberry Compote and Vanilla Whipped Cream  ~From August 2007 Epicurean Adventure: Tribute to Summer~  Chteau Gravas, Sauternes, France   Great value off the strip.  I'll definitely visit there again.

ZNX2hCVFp0xSa455N_AnvQ.text: I went here last time I was in Vegas two years ago. LOVE restaurant.com and their big certificates! I went here for a speical dinner with my now wife and it was downright amazing. I had surf and turf and i have to say this absolutly another top 5 steak i've ever had. What made this place better was the gift certificate!

hvXkH7jWSbCWjRnN-TOyuA.text: We searched all over yelp for a place to go have dinner while visiting Vegas turned out the best place was just under our nose we were staying the Renaissance (where Envy is located) One of our friends got a credit for the steakhouse for booking a room..which was cool and went a long way. Everyones food was really good the meats are not served with any sides, sides a big enough to split I got the lobster mac and cheese, i know this sounds like what at a fancy restaurant but it was so good I want to go back all the was from Midway City just to get some mac and cheese wasn't too rich and melted in your mouth.  I also got the prawns but i wouldn't recommended them...for the steak for pork chop..the pork chop was giant!! and it was organic. Our service was great too mos def earned that big tip :)

ckV2ICgWk4T2zBfYFMRW4g.text: If you're looking for a nice steak house, off the strip, this is a place to try out. I have been here a couple times on the recommendation of some friends that love food, and it does not disappoint. Their steaks are juicy and very tasty! Add on some of the different salts they provide to give it some extra taste. For a side dish, I always get the creamed corn here. Their breads that they server are also really good! Apparantly they get them from a local bakery. There's one with small chocolate chips in it...yum! The couple times I have been here, it's not been very crowded. Not sure why not, the food is great! Definitely check out restaurants.com for discounted dining certificates here.

Sj2ntRQwkUHoVB2mjnUUIA.text: We looked at all the options in Las Vegas for a great steak, and decided to venture to Envy. The place was pretty empty on a Saturday night, but it could also because of the economy. The food was excellent! The rib eye was tender and juicy. The mac and cheese sample platter was great also. Everything was top notch. Will definitely come back again.

HDvB3LN8R8EWd4WmFdbdng.text: 3 stars for the food + 4 stars for service = 3.5 stars  I was craving a good steak and it came down to going to Del Frisco's again or trying something new.  I opted for something new which was not a good idea.  I ordered the bone-in ribeye and my girlfriend ordered the "salt brick" roasted chicken.  The ribeye is considered their signature dish but it was average at best.  It was too charred on the outside and it overpowered the flavor of the meat.  The roasted chicken was not bad from what I can remember.  Other people claim it to be too salty but I didn't notice it.  We also ordered the bacon and gruyere mashed potatoes, which was delicious, and their signature truffle fries.  All the reviews hyped it up to be the greatest thing in the world but I'll have to disagree.  They do give a lot though, enough for atleast six people. The hotel and decor of the restaurant is really nice and the service was great but for me its all about the food.  Unfortunately, I wasn't impressed enough by it to consider going here again.

t-W4RyVKxpwt8TmPGcEItw.text: I was looking for a nice restaurant off the strip to enjoy my birthday dinner.  The Renaissance usually has excellent cuisine and this was no exception.  The steak was done to perfection and the service was good.  The menu was a little skimpy, but perfectly adequate.  The ambience was nice and high class.  Not too busy the night we were there, but some low-life folks at the convention spilled over a little bit.  When will young people learn to have a little class?    My only objection, which applies to most modern restaurants, is the extremely inadequate 2-person tables--especially the ones stuck against a wall.  I refuse to fight such a table and will walk out of a restaurant before being punished by being seated there.  What are restaurants thinking of with this innovation?  I would rather stay home.  An upscale hotel like this--especially a Marriott brand--should be more sophisticated than this.     Insist on a spacious table and enjoy the great food.

1jWOI4x3E0Jc6Jl_wLjByw.text: Well we decided to finally try Envy because we always stay at the hotel that it is in  while in Vegas.   We had just driven from California through Death Valley and were pretty tired so we didn't feel like driving the strip looking for dinner so we decided to eat at the hotel.  The decor was really nice.  I don't have much to say about the food though.  My fish was ok, but nothing spectacular.  My husband's steak was very small and not cooked that well.  His $7 potato was pretty good though.   In my opinion the food was over priced for the quantity  and quality.  I probably will not eat here again.

cDFwcUuwnOWdVZ8xr4X6ew.text: My boyfriend took me here for Valentines dinner. It was FABULOUS!! They had a special menu that was $65/person without wine and $81/person with wine.  The menu's were seperated by gender (a his and her's menu), and each course (4) came with a seperate wine. It started light with a rosemary bread and butter, to a salad, fancy crab cake, your choice of entree and then dessert. Each course was beautiful to look at and exquisite to taste. I must admit...I wanted my boyfriend's custard dessert more than my chocolate cake. By the end of the meal, I was stuffed and couldn't stand straight because of all of the food-gasims I was having in one night. Please...try this at least once in your life time...it will be an adventure!!

wHLAV2LfXQI56ciWEndrsw.text: Amazing food.  The meats were very tender and the presentation was superb.  My friends took me here for my birthday and they gave us free champagne!  The waiter was super cool...and gave us recommendations on places to go.

COUfiZtTTKyTPPZVMwzOcQ.text: coming to vegas to hang out me and my girlfriend decided to try this steakhouse it was behind the wynn so it wasn't too far.  being the meat eater i am i yelped a few reviews and found out that the rib eye is a must. and it REALLY IS A MUST!!!! my girlfriend got the fish and she was pretty sad cause it wasn't that great.   so for all of you meat eaters and non-meat eaters read the name of the restaurant! and order a rib eye because you will not be disappointed!! i will be back!

DPPwtAS6WONTxeUnCDWbFA.text: Being in the restaurant business, I truly hate to have to give a poor review, and often I think of the owner and so I feel that if you can't say something good, say nothing.  However, our experience at Envy was so poor, in a city where choices abound, it's necessary to warn others that this is NOT a good representative choice in Las Vegas.  My husband had the lamb which was not cooked correctly - you know how it gets that weird odor when overcooked? - yup.  My steak was greasy-fatty, the mac&cheese side was greasy, salads plain and unremarkable.  It's kind of sad because we were treated to dinner by a vendor with the best intentions, but none of us had tried the restaurant and would not go back. I did have a creme brulee which was paired with an icewine, and that was quite good, but not good enough to save the meal.  I'm sorry, but one star is all this restaurant gets from us.

RXJpePMkZcwagsMAxQtDNg.text: Very friendly staff. Food was good. My husband had the t-bone, asked for medium but he received it medium-rare but he powered through it. Came w/ a side of garlic mash & grilled veggies. Didn't care for the veggies but the mashed potatoes were delectable. I had the caesar salad & a side of asparagus. Both were delicious. Not big wine drinkers but if u are they offer up an extensive list. I enjoyed there bread basket just wish it arrived earlier than w/ our meal. Our server, Joshua was nice, a little too chatty for me but better than being snotty. The service was excellent and food was really great overall. I wish they offered more chicken entrees though, the one they did have included every vegetable I hate.

AtAFacjJUm2GqA-GhRgSIQ.text: We decided to try this place when travelzoo offered a special prefix menu for $80. first the restaurant is a bit off the beaten path- if your staying on the strip it's a 10-15min. cab ride. When we first arrived the restaurant was maybe half full- the host told us it would be 10-15 minutes???? not sure why but no big deal. Our server was very friendly and efficient. We ordered a bottle of wine which was very reasonable. The food was good but not great. We started with a truffle soup which was a bit bland and too salty  then came the entree  I had a petite filet and my friend had the pork chop both were cooked the way we requested. The only dissapointment was the dessert- a creme brule that had a jellylike substance on the top-it had a weird feeling in the mouth. overall good but not memorable.

NTwjc9Ir6nnCBh1237wZMQ.text: Last Thursday while attending a conference six of us had the pleasure of dining at Envy's. We were seated promptly and Joshua spent time with us discussing the various offerings. Three of us had the rib eye and the other three had seafood. All dishes were excellent and the drinks were great. We all will return on our next visit.

_zEFJrLHGPbgf3Bpdd0JoQ.text: An overall great experience! I had chicken that was the best I can remember, my girlfriend had a steak that she said was the best ever. The waiter suggested a bottle of wine that my girlfriend loved and she is not a wine drinker! Also would suggest the whiskey cream corn and the mac & cheese! Would definitely be excited to come back!!

q0u1tJzM3pC53WEcWT638w.text: Saving the best review for last and what a way to wrap up our Vegas adventure. We have been eating at a lot of high end steakhouses this year. I knew we wanted to go to a fancy place to celebrate my guy's birthday and since we were staying at The Renaissance and after reading the stellar reviews of this restaurant on Yelp, I knew this would be the restaurant for us.
